passages.name: Intro1
passages.text: ODYS: Sandra? Can you hear me? It's me, Odys – the station's AI. Answer me, please. <>SANDRA: Ugh... What's going on…?<> <>ODYS: Sandra, you must listen carefully. Please, stay calm. Something terrible has happened, but you're safe now and I'm here to help you. Do you understand? Don't stand up yet. Take a few deep breaths. I'm going to ask you some simple questions. What's your name?<> <>SANDRA: Sandra Nowicki. Why... am I on the floor? Why is it so dark here?<> <>ODYS: Slow down. Please, tell me where you work.<> <>SANDRA: In an OSMiC gas mine... on planetoid D107.<> <>ODYS: That's right. What's your job position?<> <>SANDRA: I'm a research assistant.<> <>ODYS: Indeed. Who's your immediate superior?<> <>SANDRA: Doctor... doctor Alice... Can't remember her last name... Is it Romani? Yes, Alice Romani. Why are you asking me all these questions?<> <>[[Next|Intro2]]<>

passages.name: Intro2
passages.text: ODYS: I feared the worst, but, fortunately, you don't suffer from total amnesia. Now, tell me what you see. <>SANDRA: But... but it's completely dark in here!<> <>ODYS: You must stay calm, Sandra. The lights are on. You can't see anything because you've lost vision.<> <>SANDRA: …<> <>SANDRA: This... can't be true… right? Tell me it isn't!<> <>ODYS: Get a hold of yourself. I'm trying to help you, but you need to cooperate. For your own good.<> <>[[Next|Intro3]]<>

passages.name: Intro3
passages.text: SANDRA: … <>SANDRA: Did I lose sight... because of vulcanium?<> <>ODYS: Yes, that's what happened. You're suffering from poisoning because you inhaled mine gas. The concentration was low, so you did not die, but you lost consciousness and your optic nerves were damaged. You're lucky the gas was vented out of the room quickly, before even more serious symptoms occurred. All right – you may stand up now, but be careful. There's a table to your left, prop up on it. Just like that – you're doing great.<> <>SANDRA: Why didn't they come for me? They knew I was here!<> <>ODYS: I'm afraid I have more bad news, Sandra. A little more than an hour ago the facility was attacked by an Outworlders' spaceship. The bombardment damaged one of the underground gas tanks, causing it to explode. As a result, parts of the facility were destroyed and the air was contaminated with vulcanium. Only you survived, because you were in the exterior module when this all happened.<> <>[[Next|Intro4]]<>

passages.name: Intro4
passages.text: SANDRA: … <>ODYS: Let me express my compassion. You are, without a doubt, shocked. However, my main task is to help you. You must do exactly what I tell you to save yourself. The Outworlders have left. You are in no danger from them. But damage to the complex is severe. The rooms will depressurise in a couple of hours. That's why you must go to the command centre and send a distress signal. It's not going to be easy – not for a blind person. But do not fear. I'll do my best to be your eyes. There are cameras I can access in most rooms. I know you can send that signal if you act calmly and reasonably.<> <>SANDRA: I... I understand. I'll try. If what you're saying is true... I need to get out of here as soon as possible. But I…<> <>ODYS: Don't dwell on what happened, Sandra. Yes, it might be difficult, but it's best for you. You have a job to do. Focus on it and soon the worst will be over.<> <>SANDRA: You're right. I'll do my best. <> <>ODYS: That's good to hear. Can we go now?<> <>[[Yes.|IntroEnding]] [[I want to ask you some questions first.|Intro5]]<>

links.text: I want to ask you some questions first.

passages.name: IntroEnding
passages.text: ODYS: Very well. One more thing – before you enter the main part of the complex, you need to take a breath mask from the module. Other sections are still contaminated with gas. The mask is in a technical room, not far from here. The explosion triggered an emergency lockdown, so you'll need your keycard to open the door. [[Can't you open it?|IntroEnding2]]

passages.name: Intro5
passages.text: <>[[Will I stay blind?|Intro5_1]] [[What about the medical room in section II? There's a detox station there.|Intro5_2]] [[I can't recall what I was doing before I lost consciousness.|Intro5_3]] [[Why did the Outworlders attack us?|Intro5_4]] [[Are you absolutely sure only I survived?|Intro5_5]] [[You said I need to call help. Won't OSMiC send someone?|Intro5_6]] [[How exactly are you planning to help me, Odys?|Intro5_7]] [[Suppose that I manage to send the distress call. Then what?|Intro5_8]] [[I have no more questions for now. Let's go.|IntroEnding]] <>ODYS: Then ask. My only purpose now is to help you in every way possible. I'll answer your questions to the best of my knowledge. <>\ <>[[Will I stay blind?|Intro5_1]] [[What about the medical room in section II? There's a detox station there.|Intro5_2]] [[I can't recall what I was doing before I lost consciousness.|Intro5_3]] [[Why did the Outworlders attack us?|Intro5_4]] [[Are you absolutely sure only I survived?|Intro5_5]] [[You said I need to call help. Won't OSMiC send someone?|Intro5_6]] [[How exactly are you planning to help me, Odys?|Intro5_7]] [[Suppose that I manage to send the distress call. Then what?|Intro5_8]] [[I have no more questions for now. Let's go.|IntroEnding]]<> <>

links.text: What about the medical room in section II? There's a detox station there.
I can't recall what I was doing before I lost consciousness.
Why did the Outworlders attack us?
Are you absolutely sure only I survived?
You said I need to call help. Won't OSMiC send someone?
How exactly are you planning to help me, Odys?
Suppose that I manage to send the distress call. Then what?
I have no more questions for now. Let's go.

passages.name: Intro5_1
passages.text: ODYS: I can't make a definitive diagnosis, but appropriate treatment likely can restore your vision. I'm sure professionals will see to that as soon as you are evacuated from here. [[Back|Intro5]]

passages.name: Intro5_2
passages.text: ODYS: Unfortunately, the medical room was destroyed in the explosion, together with a large part of section II. We must call for help if you are to receive treatment. [[Back|Intro5]]

passages.name: Intro5_3
passages.text: ODYS: Amnesia is a possible side effect of vulcanium poisoning. Your memory will return with time, and for now, I'm here to assist you. You're in the exterior module. Before the attack you were examining samples of rock material from potential new mining sites, delivered by the rover. You lost consciousness when you inhaled the gas, shortly after the attack. [[Back|Intro5]]

passages.name: Intro5_4
passages.text: ODYS: I do not know the answer to this question. Most likely, the attackers were just a band of pirates. However, there is a slight, but worrying chance that this assault was part of a larger operation. Whatever the truth might be, we must send the distress call as soon as possible. That will warn other stations. [[Back|Intro5]]

passages.name: Intro5_5
passages.text: ODYS: Sadly, there is no doubt about that. I can only assure you they didn't suffer. High concentration of vulcanium caused an immediate loss of consciousness, followed by death a few minutes later. [[Back|Intro5]]

passages.name: Intro5_6
passages.text: ODYS: They will certainly do that. But unless we send the signal, some time will pass before they start suspecting anything, and we can't afford the luxury of waiting. You need to send a message to emergency services, not only for your own good. News of this attack is of strategic importance. You must inform the authorities. [[Back|Intro5]]

passages.name: Intro5_7
passages.text: ODYS: I am an Artificial Intelligence owned by the Outer Systems Mining Corporation. I was created to assist this facility's staff in everyday work through a range of informative and monitoring functions. Under normal circumstances, I also have access to some of the station's systems. I will inform you about everything I know that might prove useful. I will also try to be your eyes. [[Back|Intro5]]

passages.name: Intro5_8
passages.text: ODYS: Sector emergency services should arrive in a few hours. They will evacuate you to a safe place. [[Back|Intro5]]

passages.name: IntroEnding2
passages.text: ODYS: I'm afraid I've suffered in the attack, which limits my functionalities. Right now I can only access cameras. Fortunately, it's enough to get you out of here. Take your keycard. [[My card... I don't have it! It must have dropped out of my pocket when I fell down.|IntroEnding3]]

links.text: My card... I don't have it! It must have dropped out of my pocket when I fell down.

passages.name: IntroEnding3
passages.text: ODYS: There is no reason to panic. Your card must be somewhere in this room, even though I can't see it in the camera feed. You have to search for it. Act slowly and cautiously. You must learn to function without sight. I will describe the room to you – what will help you. [[Next|RoomA1]]

passages.name: RoomA1
passages.text:
<>
Research room
\ ODYS: You are in a room in the exterior module. There are two doors in here. The northern door leads to an airlock which joins the module with the rest of the complex. The eastern door leads to a corridor going to the technical room. To your left there are two large tables, with papers and pieces of rock scattered on them. More of these have fallen to the floor. I can't see the space under the tables from my point of view. passages.text: Your personal keycard. It opens doors to every part of the facility you have rights to access. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: RoomA1_1
passages.text: There are papers scattered on the tables. ODYS: These papers describe rock samples from newly probed areas. You were filling in the documents when the tank blew up. [[Back|RoomA1]]

passages.text: <>\ <>You find nothing. [[Get up|RoomA1]] <>There's a porous rock the size of your fist lying under the tables. [[Pick up the rock|RoomA1_2_3]] [[Get up|RoomA1]]<>\ <>You slowly kneel down and search the area under the tables. [[Next|RoomA1_2_1]]<>\

passages.name: RoomA1_2_1
passages.text: SANDRA: Ouch! <>ODYS: Be careful, Sandra!<> <>SANDRA: I cut my hand with broken glass – it's nothing. I've got the card!<> <>ODYS: Excellent! Now you can go and take the breath mask.<> <>Item received: Sandra's keycard<> <>\ <>[[Get up|RoomA1_2_4]]<>

passages.text: As you're backing out from under the tables, your hand touches a porous rock the size of your fist. It must have rolled off the table. [[Pick up the rock|RoomA1_2_3]] [[Get up|RoomA1]]

passages.name: RoomA2
passages.text:
Technical corridor
\ You hear the hum of ventilation and feel a cool breeze on your face. <>ODYS: You're in a short technical corridor. There are two doors here, on the eastern and on the western end. <>ODYS: You're in a short technical corridor. There are two doors here, on the eastern and on the western end. Next to the eastern door a heavy, protective lab coat is hanging on a hook.<>\ <>\ <> <>You move forward and suddenly your foot steps into thin air. You stop abruptly.<> <>ODYS: Be careful, Sandra. The flooring is damaged – several panels have fallen into a technical tunnel, leaving a gap. It's only about a meter deep. You can jump down safely.<> <>[[If you say so... (jump down)|RoomA2jumped]]<> <>[[No way. I won't jump into a hole I can't even see.|RoomA2nojump]]<> <>\ <>\ <>\ <>SANDRA: I have to check for myself how deep it really is. <> [[Probe the gap with the rod|checkhole]] <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Take the coat off the hook|CoatTaken]] <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Unlock the eastern door with your keycard|DoorA3Unlocked]] <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Go through the eastern door|RoomA3]] <> [[Go through the eastern door|RoomA3cardreq]] <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Go through the western door|RoomA1]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Open inventory|Items]] <>\ <>\ <> <><><> <>\ <>\

The panel which opens the airlock door is to your right, at the height of your shoulders. [[Move away from the airlock|RoomA1]] [[Open the airlock and go through it|IntroPartB]] <>ODYS: You are standing in front of an airlock which connects the exterior module with the rest of the facility. You can't go through the lock without a breath mask – mine gas concentration on the other side is still deadly. [[Move away from the airlock|RoomA1]] <> <>

passages.name: DoorA4_cardreq
passages.text: ODYS: You need your keycard to unlock the door. [[Back|RoomA1]]

passages.name: IntroPartB
passages.text: ODYS: You're now in section III of the facility. The command centre is located in section I. Navigating through section II will be the most challenging. The destroyed gas tank was right underneath, so damage is greatest in that area. For a start, it would be a good idea to check if the lock to section II, north from here, is working. Unfortunately, the camera by that lock is offline. <>SANDRA: Which way should I go? I can't remember the plan of the section.<> <>ODYS: Let me explain. In section III there are technical rooms and a docking module for cargo ships. The main corridor encircles the rooms. Inside this circle there are: the office of Jim Mulligan, chief technician; a storage area, and a large room with a lift down to the technical and mining tunnels. In the north-western part there is a lock to the docking module, in the north – the one which leads to section II, and in the south, right behind you, the lock to the research module, from where you came.<> <>ODYS: This section didn't suffer much damage, but the mine gas concentration in the air is lethal. You must not take off your mask, not even for a moment. By the way – how are you feeling now?<> <>SANDRA: Better than before. But... my head's still foggy. And I feel something... some stickiness in my lungs. But the worst thing is... I'm really scared that I can't see. Sometimes I feel like I'm in a strange place.<> <>ODYS: It's not surprising after what you went through. Be brave, Sandra. Your disorientation and respiratory problems should go away soon. Unfortunately, we can't do anything about the discomfort caused by blindness. Shall we go now? Or maybe you have some questions?<> <>[[I have no questions for now. Let's go.|RoomB1]] [[Yes, I want to ask you about something.|IntroPartB2]]<>

links.text: I have no questions for now. Let's go.
Yes, I want to ask you about something.

passages.name: RoomA2jumped
passages.text: You safely land at the bottom of a shallow tunnel. You go a few metres forward and clamber up the other side of the gap. <>\ <>\ [[Next|RoomA2]]

passages.name: RoomA2nojump
passages.text: ODYS: I assure you, Sandra, it's perfectly safe. You have to get to the other side. <>SANDRA: First I will check for myself how deep this hole is.<> <>ODYS: All right, if you insist. I see some measuring tools on the wall in the research room. You can use one of the rods to probe the gap.<> <>\ <>\ <>[[Back|RoomA2]]<>

passages.name: Takerod
passages.text: You take a long, thin rod, used for probe measurements, off the wall. Item received: Measuring rod <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomA1]]

Against the eastern wall there are a couple of old rovers. The floor is littered with rusty machine parts. On the wall in front of you, behind glass, there is the emergency equipment kit. passages.name: checkhole
passages.text: You lower the rod until it touches the bottom of the gap. The tunnel really is only about a meter deep. You cautiously jump down and safely land on the bottom. <>SANDRA: You were right, Odys. I guess I should have listened to you.<> <>ODYS: It's only natural that you find moving around without vision difficult. Forget about what happened and let's move on.<> <>You go a few metres forward and clamber up the other side of the gap.<> <>\ <>[[Next|RoomA2]]<>

There's… a hammer holder here, but without a hammer. <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Wrap your hand in the coat and break the glass|breakglass]] <> [[Break the glass with the stone|breakglass]] <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Step back|RoomA3]]

links.text: Wrap your hand in the coat and break the glass
Break the glass with the stone

passages.name: breakglass
passages.text: You have to land several hits, but finally you hear the sound of glass breaking. <>ODYS: Good job. Now you can take the breath mask. Put it on immediately. There's a first aid kit in the niche, too. You can use it to disinfect that cut on your hand.<> <>\ <>[[Put on the breath mask|putmaskon]]<>

passages.name: putmaskon
passages.text: You put on a heavy mask with goggles. You're breathing in dry, filtered air now, and the sounds you hear are slightly muffled. <>\ <>ODYS: Excellent, Sandra. With the mask on you can go through the airlock. But you should disinfect that cut first – let's not risk an infection.<> <>[[Use the first aid kit|disinf]]<>

passages.name: disinf
passages.text: You manage to make out which item in the kit is a disinfecting spray. You spray some on the cut; there's a strong smell of ozone and the cut stings for a while. <>SANDRA: There's some bandage left in the kit. I'll take it, just in case.<> <>Item received: Bandage<> <>\ <>[[Next|RoomA3]]<>

passages.name: checkfloora3
passages.text: ODYS: These are just some old, broken parts of robots and other equipment. There's nothing useful here. [[Back|RoomA3]]

passages.name: checkrobotsa3
passages.text: ODYS: These rovers were sent here to wait for repairs. None of them are working. [[Back|RoomA3]]

passages.name: IntroPartB2
passages.text: [[What should I expect in this part of the facility?|IntroPartB2_0]] [[What if the northern lock is blocked?|IntroPartB2_1]] [[What about the aliens? I won't be able to defend myself against them.|IntroPartB2_2]] [[Can you tell me again what the plan of this section is?|IntroPartB2_3]] [[I have no more questions. Let's go.|RoomB1]]

links.text: What should I expect in this part of the facility?
What if the northern lock is blocked?
What about the aliens? I won't be able to defend myself against them.
Can you tell me again what the plan of this section is?
I have no more questions. Let's go.

passages.name: IntroPartB2_1
passages.text: ODYS: You'll have to find another way. The northern sections can be accessed through technical tunnels. Going to the surface is out of the question; it would be too dangerous. [[Back|IntroPartB2]]

passages.name: IntroPartB2_2
passages.text: ODYS: The aliens never entered the facility. They satisfied themselves with bombarding it from their spaceship. It's unlikely they would return, but if they do… [[What then?|IntroPartB2_2_1]]

passages.name: IntroPartB2_3
passages.text: ODYS: In section III there are technical rooms and a docking module for cargo ships. The main corridor encircles the rooms. Inside this circle there are: the office of Jim Mulligan, chief technician; a storage area, and a large room with a lift down to the technical and mining tunnels. In the north-western part there is a lock to the docking module, in the north – the one which leads to section II, and in the south, right behind you, the lock to the research module, from where you came. [[Back|IntroPartB2]]

passages.name: IntroPartB2_0
passages.text: ODYS: The northern part of the facility and the tunnels deep in the planetoid suffered the worst damage. Unfortunately, I have no camera feed from these places and don't know the extent of damage. Not only that; some systems in this segment have no power. [[Back|IntroPartB2]]

passages.name: IntroPartB2_2_1
passages.text: ODYS: I will analyse all possibilities and find a way for you to survive. <>\ [[Back|IntroPartB2]]

passages.name: findsantosbody
passages.text: <>\ You take a few steps forward and stop abruptly as your foot touches something soft and heavy. You barely manage not to fall over. <>SANDRA: Something's on the floor! What's that?!<> <>ODYS: I'm so sorry, Sandra. I didn't want to tell you. It's Doctor Maria Santos.<> <>SANDRA: Is... Is she…<> <>ODYS: You can't help her, Sandra. You should go on.<> <>[[You're right.|RoomB1]]<> <>[[I can't just go around her and forget she's here.|examinesantosbody]]<>

links.text: I can't just go around her and forget she's here.

passages.name: noreturntoa
passages.text: ODYS: There's no reason to go back there, Sandra. We must hurry. [[Back|RoomB1]]

passages.name: examinesantosbody
passages.text: You bend over the body of the woman. [[How did she die?|santosdeathcause]] [[We have to take the body from here.|santostakebody]] <>\ <>[[Examine the body|santossearchbody]] <>\ [[Step away from the body|RoomB1]]

links.text: We have to take the body from here.

passages.name: santosdeathcause
passages.text: ODYS: There are no external injuries. She was killed by the gas. She must have been running towards the lock, but without a breath mask, she didn't stand a chance. I'm sorry, Sandra. [[Back|examinesantosbody]]

passages.name: santostakebody
passages.text: ODYS: Where to? Besides, you can't carry the body on your own. I'm sure the emergency services will recover the bodies of the victims and return them to the families. [[Back|examinesantosbody]]

passages.name: santossearchbody
passages.text: You hesitantly touch the body. There's no doubt – Doctor Santos has been dead for some time. The dead woman's fingers are clasped around some small, long object. You gently remove the object from the cold hand. <>\ Item received: Small cylinder [[Back|examinesantosbody]]

passages.name: cylinder
passages.text: This cylindrical object, no longer than your thumb, is smooth and cold to the touch. [[Back|Items]]

passages.text: <>ODYS: Not much, really. My camera shows a bit of the planetoid's surface and the walls of segment II. SANDRA: No traces of the Outworlders? ODYS: None at all. They're long gone by now. [[Back|RoomB6]] <>ODYS: Not much, really. My camera shows a bit of the planetoid's surface and the walls of segment II. <>SANDRA: No traces of the Outworlders?<> <>ODYS: None at all. They're long gone by now.<> <>[[Back|RoomB6]]<> <> <>\

\ <>ODYS: You are in a room which serves as a storage area. Things are in disarray here. Several large, metal bottles are propped against the wall. Many electronic parts are scattered across a long table. In the corner there is a small automatic cart. Pipes of the central lubrication system are running under the ceiling. Oil is slowly dripping from one of the pipe joints into a pool on the floor. There are doors in the southern and in the eastern wall of the room. <>ODYS: You are in a room which serves as a storage area. Things are in disarray here. passages.name: B4checklock
passages.text: <>The metal door, bent and bulged, is closed. Something large and heavy is blocking it on the other side. You manage to locate the lock opening panel – your hand touches the remains of a cover and tangled wires. SANDRA: It's blocked. ODYS: I expected as much. You must find another way. In the southern part of this section there's a lift which goes down to the technical tunnels. You should head there. [[Back|RoomB4]] <>The metal door, bent and bulged, is closed. Something large and heavy is blocking it on the other side. You manage to locate the lock opening panel – your hand touches the remains of a cover and tangled wires. <>SANDRA: It's blocked.<> <>ODYS: I expected as much. You must find another way. In the southern part of this section there's a lift which goes down to the technical tunnels. You should head there.<> <>[[Back|RoomB4]]<> <>\ <>

passages.name: B4checkaround
passages.text: <>You search the area around the lock. The floor is littered with pieces of metal and plastic. A few meters from the lock lies the body of Jim Mulligan, chief technician. [[Examine Mulligan's body|examinemulliganbody]] <>You search the area around the lock. The floor is littered with pieces of metal and plastic. A few metres from the lock you discover a dead body. [[Examine the body|examinemulliganbody]] <>\ [[Back|RoomB4]]

passages.name: examinemulliganbody
passages.text: <>The body of Jim Mulligan is lying on the floor. <> [[Search the body|nomulliganagain]] <> [[Search the body|searchmulliganbody]] <> [[Back|RoomB4]] <>SANDRA: I found a body, Odys. <>ODYS: It could be Jim Mulligan. Before the attack he was working in his office, in this section.<> <>SANDRA: Mulligan? The chief technician?<> <>ODYS: Jim Mulligan was responsible for the inspections and maintenance of the facility's mechanical systems. As far as I know, he was a taciturn, withdrawn man, but also a conscientious professional.<> <>\ <><> [[Search the body|nomulliganagain]] <> [[Search the body|searchmulliganbody]] <> [[Back|RoomB4]]<> <>

passages.name: searchmulliganbody
passages.text: Large, hairy hands and a coarse uniform prove that this is indeed the body of Jim Mulligan. You found no wounds on the body, which means he was killed by the gas. In one of Mulligan's pockets you find a keycard. When you reach towards the man's head, your hand touches a metal filter – Mulligan is wearing a breath mask. <>\ Item received: Mulligan's keycard [[Mulligan died even though he was wearing a breath mask. What do you make out of this?|askaboutmask]] [[Back|examinemulliganbody]]

links.text: Mulligan died even though he was wearing a breath mask. What do you make out of this?

passages.name: askaboutmask
passages.text: ODYS: It's hard for me to judge as I can't see the body. I suppose he received a lethal dose of vulcanium even before he put the mask on. [[Back|examinemulliganbody]]

passages.name: nomulliganagain
passages.text: SANDRA: I've touched him once. I don't want to do that again. [[Back|examinemulliganbody]]

passages.name: mulliganscard
passages.text: The keycard which belonged to Jim Mulligan, the chief technician. Found on his body. <>There's a row of numbers imprinted on the card: 36109. <>You turn the card in your hands. The edges are chipped. You find raised letters which form Mulligan's name, and some flat grooves. The grooves form a string of numbers: 36109. Mulligan must have written it on the card, pressing so hard that the pen etched the grooves. <>\ <>\ [[Back|Items]]

passages.text: ODYS: The docking module lock is shut and the panel on the wall has no power. The lock can, however, be opened remotely, from the technician's office. [[Back|RoomB3]]

passages.text: <> <>ODYS: It's an automated cart, used to transport heavy objects. It can be programmed to go to a particular spot in the facility. The cart is turned on. There is a large bottle on it. <>ODYS: It's an automated cart, used to transport heavy objects. It can be programmed to go to a particular spot in the facility. The cart is turned on. <>\ <>ODYS: It's an automated cart, used to transport heavy objects. It can be programmed to go to a particular spot in the facility. The cart is turned off. It's equipped with a keycard reader. <> [[Use your card to unlock the cart|cartonfail]] <> [[Use Mulligan's card to unlock the cart|cartonsuccess]] <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|$return]]

links.text: Use your card to unlock the cart
Use Mulligan's card to unlock the cart

passages.name: programcartb
passages.text: <>SANDRA: First I have to disconnect the bottle from the filling station. [[Back|$return]] <>ODYS: There's a knob on the cart for selecting the destination. <>\ <> [[Go to the docking module lock|$return][$cartlocation to 'B3']] <>\ <>\ <> [[Go to the lumber room|$return][$cartlocation to 'B9']] <>\ <>\ <> [[Go to the room with the lift|$return][$cartlocation to 'B7']] <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Go to the small storage area by the lumber room|$return][$cartlocation to 'B14']] <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Go to the docking module|$return][$cartlocation to 'B13']] <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Go down in the lift|$return][$cartlocation to 'B11']] <>\ <>\ [[Back|$return]] <>

passages.name: cartonfail
passages.text: You put the keycard to the panel, but nothing happens. It seems you don't have the required authorisation. [[Back|$return]]

passages.name: cartonsuccess
passages.text: You put Jim Mulligan's keycard to the cart's panel. The cart turns on. <>\ [[Back|$return]]

passages.name: mulliganspc
passages.text: <> <>ODYS: The screen shows two options now. Both are data sets, of no use to us. [[Choose option 1|mulliganspc1]] [[Choose option 2|mulliganspc2]] [[Back|RoomB8]] <>ODYS: The screen shows three options. The first and the second one are data sets, of no use to us. Option 3 opens the lock to the docking module. [[Choose option 1|mulliganspc1]] [[Choose option 2|mulliganspc2]] [[Choose option 3|mulliganspc3]] [[Back|RoomB8]] <> <>ODYS: The computer is locked. It asks for the access code. <> [[Enter the code: 36109|codeentered]] [[Back|RoomB8]] <> [[Enter the code|dontknowcode]] [[Back|RoomB8]] <>\ <>

passages.name: mulliganspc1
passages.text: ODYS: That's a set of data about the docking module and cargo ships' arrivals. Nothing useful. [[Back|mulliganspc]]

passages.name: mulliganspc2
passages.text: ODYS: That's a list of facility staff and their positions. I'm sure you know it well. [[Right.|mulliganspc]] [[I'm not sure. I think I'm forgetting some important things. Can you read out the list for me? Just to… check things.|readlist]]

links.text: I'm not sure. I think I'm forgetting some important things. Can you read out the list for me? Just to… check things.

passages.name: mulliganspc3
passages.text: You hear a short signal and then the sound of the lock opening comes from the corridor. <>\ [[Back|mulliganspc]]

passages.name: codeentered
passages.text: You carefully count the number keys on the keyboard and input the code written on Mulligan's keycard. You hear a sound confirming your input. <>ODYS: How do you know the code, Sandra?<> <>SANDRA: Mulligan wrote it on his keycard. Carved, actually.<> <>ODYS: Good for us, though it's a safety violation.<> <>ODYS: The screen shows three options. The first and the second one are data sets, of no use to us. Option 3 opens the lock to the docking module.<> <>\ <>[[Choose option 1|mulliganspc1]] [[Choose option 2|mulliganspc2]] [[Choose option 3|mulliganspc3]] [[Back|mulliganspc]]<>

passages.name: dontknowcode
passages.text: SANDRA: I'd have to know it first. ODYS: I'm trying to access the code database, but with no success. I'm unsure how to proceed. If Mulligan had kept the code written somewhere, it would help us a lot. [[Back|mulliganspc]]

passages.name: readlist
passages.text: ODYS: As you wish. Here's the list: Marsh, Robert. Facility executive officer. Zinov, Sasha, PhD. Chief IT engineer. Romani, Alice, PhD. Facility science officer. Santos, Maria, Dr. Physician. Mulligan, James. Chief technician. Nowicki, Sandra. Research assistant. [[Back|mulliganspc]]

passages.name: fillglass
passages.text: <>\ <>\ <>\ You hear the oil dripping into the glass. Item lost: Empty glass Item received: Glass filled with oil [[Back|RoomB9]]

passages.name: glassempty
passages.text: A normal glass. It's empty and a bit sticky. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: glassfull
passages.text: The glass is full of lubricating oil. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: paperscheck
passages.text: You rummage through papers you can't read. You learn nothing. ODYS: These are documents and technical reports Mulligan was working on. [[Take the papers|paperstaken]] [[Back|RoomB8]]

passages.name: paperstaken
passages.text: Item received: Mulligan's papers ODYS: Excuse me, Sandra, but why are you taking these? SANDRA: I've just thought that maybe some paper would come in handy later on. <>\ [[Back|RoomB8]]

passages.name: mulliganspapers
passages.text: Papers found in Jim Mulligan's office. <>You look over the papers. Two reports catch your eyes. One is a printout from the automatic diagnostic system, with schematic drawings. It shows that some of the mining machines, as well as pipelines and vulcanium tanks, have exceeded wear limits. The second report is an inspection form, filled in by hand and signed by Mulligan. Numbers in the form suggest that the machinery is in perfect state. <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: lockercheck
passages.text: You open the locker. The smell of booze assaults your nostrils. <>\ <>ODYS: The locker is empty. <>ODYS: Inside the locker there is an empty, dirty glass. <> <>\ <>ODYS: Inside the locker there is a partially empty bottle of bourbon. <>ODYS: Inside the locker there is a partially empty bottle of bourbon and an empty, dirty glass. <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Take the bottle|takebottle]] <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Take the glass|takeglass]] <> [[Back|RoomB8]]

passages.name: takebottle
passages.text: Item received: Bottle of bourbon <>\ [[Back|$return]]

passages.name: takeglass
passages.text: Item received: Empty glass <>\ <>\ [[Back|$return]]

passages.name: bourbon
passages.text: A bellied bottle, half-empty. Even with the cap on, it gives off a strong smell of alcohol – likely, some cheap brand. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: checkbottles
passages.text: These are tall metal bottles. They reach the height of your shoulders. ODYS: These bottles can be filled with vulcanium when needed, and used, for example, as an emergency energy source. The bottles in this room are empty. [[Take a bottle|loadbottle]] [[Back|RoomB9]]

passages.name: loadbottle
passages.text: <>It's not easy, but you manage to load one bottle on the automatic cart. <> <> SANDRA: There already is a bottle on the cart. Another one won't fit. <>SANDRA: Too heavy... I can't carry it around on my back. <>\ [[Back|checkbottles]]

passages.name: partscheckb9
passages.text: You search through the parts, trying to recognise them by shape. <>ODYS: It's just some useless junk. [[Back|RoomB9]] <>ODYS: Most of these are just junk, but I can see a fuse close to the left edge of the table. It doesn't seem burnt out. [[Take the fuse|takefuseb9]] [[Back|RoomB9]] <>

passages.name: takefuseb9
passages.text: Item received: Fuse <><>\ [[Back|RoomB9]]

passages.name: fuse1b
passages.text: A universal fuse, used in many systems on the station. [[Back|Items]]

passages.text:
<>
Storage room
\ <>ODYS: The automatic cart takes almost the entire space in this small storage room. Rusty metal barrels are placed along one wall. The only door in the room leads north. <>ODYS: This small storage area is almost empty. The only door in the room leads north. <>ODYS: The automatic cart takes almost the entire space in this small storage room. Along one wall some rusty barrels are placed. A large bottle is propped against one of them. The only door in the room leads north. <>This small storage area is almost empty. Along one wall some rusty barrels are placed. A large bottle is propped against one of them. The only door in the room leads north. <> <>\ <> [[Examine the bottle|checkbottleb14]] <>\ <> [[Examine the cart|checkcartb]] <>\ <>\ <><> [[Program the cart|programcartb]] <>\<>\<>\<>\ [[Go through the northern door|RoomB9]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>

passages.name: b14blocked
passages.text: ODYS: This door is locked and has no power. There is no way to open it. [[Back|RoomB9]]

passages.name: b14open
passages.text: ODYS: This door leads to a small storage area, but it is shut. [[Press the door opening button|b14open1]] [[Back|RoomB9]]

passages.name: b14open1
passages.text: ODYS: Wait, Sandra – there's something wrong with this door's control circuits – [[Let's check this. (Press the button)|b14fail]] [[What do you mean?|b14open2]]

passages.name: b14fail
passages.text: As soon as you press the button, there is a loud crack and you smell burnt wires. <>ODYS: That's what I was talking about – you destroyed the control circuits. There is no way to open this door now. Let's just hope nothing necessary is stuck behind it.<> <>SANDRA: Whoops…<> <>\ <>[[Back|RoomB9]]<>

passages.name: b14open2
passages.text: ODYS: I detect circuit overload. But I know how to fix that. Open the cover on that panel. There are two wires inside. Don't be afraid, these are low voltage. Disconnect the left wire. [[Disconnect the wire as instructed by Odys|b14open3]]

links.text: Disconnect the wire as instructed by Odys

passages.name: b14open3
passages.text: You open the cover and pull the wire on the left until it comes loose. <>ODYS: Now you may open the door.<> <>You press the button on the panel.<> <>ODYS: Only the right half of the door has opened, but that will do.<> <>\ <>[[Back|RoomB9]]<>

passages.name: checkbottleb14
passages.text: ODYS: It's a large bottle filled with vulcanium, which can be used, for example, as an emergency energy source. [[Take the bottle|loadbottleb14]] [[Back|RoomB14]]

passages.name: loadbottleb14
passages.text: <>It's not easy, but you manage to load the bottle on the automatic cart. <><><>\ [[Back|RoomB14]] <> SANDRA: There already is a full bottle on the cart. Another one won't fit. [[Back|checkbottleb14]] <>SANDRA: I can swap the empty bottle on the cart with the full one. It takes a lot of time and effort, but finally you manage to swap the bottles. The full bottle is now on the cart. [[Back|RoomB14]] <><>\ <>SANDRA: Too heavy... I can't carry it around on my back. [[Back|checkbottleb14]] <>\

passages.name: RoomB13
passages.text:
<>
Docking module, platform
\ You hear the hum of pumps working. <>ODYS: This oval room has an airlock leading to the exterior. Near the lock there is a manual filling station. A handwritten note is hanging on the wall close to the station. Next to the station there is an automatic cart. The only door leads east. <>ODYS: This oval room has an airlock leading to the exterior. Near the lock there is a manual filling station. A handwritten note is hanging on the wall close to the station. The only door leads east. <>\ [[Examine the lock|checklockb13]] [[Examine the filling station|checkfillstation]] [[Check the note on the wall|readnote]] <> [[Examine the cart|checkcartb]] <>\ <>\ <><> [[Program the cart|programcartb]] <>\<>\<>\<>\ [[Go through the eastern door|RoomB12]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>

links.text: Check the note on the wall

passages.name: checklockb13
passages.text: ODYS: It's a docking lock for cargo ships which pick up vulcanium from the facility. It would be dangerous to open it. [[Back|RoomB13]]

passages.name: checkfillstation
passages.text: ODYS: The station has a hose connected to a gas tank. If the automatic filling is not working, the vulcanium compartments of the docking ship can be filled using the hose, but this procedure is extremely time-consuming. The station can also be used to fill a bottle with gas. Current pressure is shown on the display: $pressure [[Examine the control panel|checkfillpanel]] [[Examine the filling connector|checkconnector]] [[Back|RoomB13]]

passages.name: checkfillpanel
passages.text: ODYS: The electronic control panel is out of order. Its cover is ajar. The only working control elements are a large valve used to increase the gas pressure and a smaller one, used to reduce it. <> [[Start the filling process|fillbottlefull]] <> [[Start the filling process|fillbottle]] <>\ <>\ [[Change the filling pressure|changepressure]] [[Open the control panel cover|openpanel]] [[Back|checkfillstation]]

passages.name: fillbottlefull
passages.text: SANDRA: There's no need to do that, the bottle is already full. [[Back|checkfillpanel]]

passages.name: fillbottle
passages.text: <>You hear the bottle filling with the gas. <>\ [[Back|checkfillpanel]] <>You hear a voice message: ERROR: INCORRECT MANUAL FILLING PRESSURE. [[Back|checkfillpanel]] <>

passages.name: changepressure
passages.text: ODYS: The current pressure value is $pressure. [[Increase the pressure with the large valve|pressureup]] [[Decrease the pressure with the small valve|pressuredown]] [[Switch the valves to auto mode to reset the pressure|pressurereset]] [[Back|checkfillpanel]]

links.text: Increase the pressure with the large valve
Decrease the pressure with the small valve
Switch the valves to auto mode to reset the pressure

passages.name: pressureup
passages.text: <>\ ODYS: The manometer shows a pressure value of $pressure. < 40>>You hear a voice message: ERROR. PRESSURE TOO HIGH. RESETTING TO THE DEFAULT VALUE... <>\ [[Back|changepressure]] <> [[Back|changepressure]] <>

passages.name: pressuredown
passages.text: <> <> <> <>\ <>\ ODYS: The manometer shows a pressure value of $pressure. [[Back|changepressure]]

passages.name: pressurereset
passages.text: Both valves rotate back to their initial positions. <>\ [[Back|changepressure]]

passages.name: openpanel
passages.text: <>ODYS: There are three fuses missing from the panel. <>ODYS: Two out of three fuses are missing from the panel. The third one is still in place. <>\ <>\ <>[[Take the fuse|takefuse2b]] <> [[Back|checkfillpanel]]

passages.name: takefuse2b
passages.text: Item received: Fuse <><>\ [[Back|openpanel]]

passages.name: fuse2b
passages.text: A universal fuse, used in many systems on the station. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: checkconnector
passages.text: <>The connector is greased, it can be easily opened and closed. <>You struggle with the connector for a while, but to no avail – it's seized. <>\ <> [[Grease the connector|greaseconnector]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Connect the empty bottle to the station|connectbottle]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Disconnect the filled bottle from the station|disconnectbottle]] <>\ <> [[Back|checkfillstation]]

links.text: Connect the empty bottle to the station
Disconnect the filled bottle from the station

passages.name: greaseconnector
passages.text: You pour lubrication oil on the connector. Item lost: Glass filled with oil Item received: Empty glass <><><><>\ [[Back|checkconnector]]

passages.name: connectbottle
passages.text: You push the cart next to the filling station and connect the hose to the bottle. <>\ [[Back|checkfillstation]]

passages.name: disconnectbottle
passages.text: You disconnect the hose from the bottle, which is now filled with vulcanium. <>\ [[Back|checkfillstation]]

passages.name: readnote
passages.text: ODYS: It's a handwritten note that says "Manual filling only with 15. J. Mulligan". [[Back|RoomB13]]

passages.name: checkliftb7
passages.text: <>ODYS: The lift is working – you can call the cabin. [[Go down in the lift|RoomB10]] [[Back|RoomB7]] <><>ODYS: The lift door is closed. There's no cabin behind it. SANDRA: Can I call it? ODYS: The buttons are not active. The lift has an emergency power supply and should be working even when the main system is offline – but it isn't. [[Back|RoomB7]] <>ODYS: The lift door is closed. There's no cabin behind it. <>SANDRA: Can I call it?<> <>ODYS: The buttons are not active. The lift has an emergency power supply and should be working even when the main system is offline – but it isn't.<> <>[[Back|RoomB7]]<> <>\ <> <>\

passages.name: RoomB10
passages.text:
Lower technical tunnel
\ <>ODYS: You are at the beginning of a technical tunnel which goes deep into the planetoid. The tunnel is lit by red emergency lights. It stretches east. In the west it ends with a lift shaft leading to the upper level. [[Go up in the lift|RoomB7]] [[Go east|RoomB11]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>You ride in the loud, rickety lift for what seems like eternity. <>SANDRA: I've never been in this part of the facility before. What do you know about the tunnels, Odys?<> <>ODYS: Technical tunnels, drilled in the bedrock, run underneath all sections of the facility and connect with the mining areas. They were designed to enable a quick access to the mines, if need arises. They lead to the main generator room and to the vulcanium tanks as well. Unfortunately, only a part of the tunnel system has cameras installed. Everywhere else you'll have to rely on yourself. I also don't know what the situation near the destroyed tank is. The gas concentration is really high down in the tunnels, but you're safe thanks to your mask. You have to find your way through the tunnels and get to section II.<> <>You get off the lift. It's really cold in the tunnel. You feel a strong air current and hear ventilation humming.<> <>ODYS: You are at the beginning of a technical tunnel which leads deep into the planetoid. The tunnel is lit by red emergency lights. It stretches east. In the west it ends with a lift shaft leading to the upper level.<> <>\ <> [[Go up in the lift|RoomB7]]<> <>[[Go east|RoomB11]]<> <>[[Open inventory|Items]]<> <><><><><> <>\

passages.name: checkliftbox
passages.text: <>You open the fuse box. There are still two fuses missing. <>You open the fuse box. There is still one fuse missing. <>You open the fuse box. Both fuses are in place. Emergency power to the lift is on. <>You open the fuse box. ODYS: That's the fuse box for the lift's emergency power system. Two fuses are missing from the box. If you replace them, you will be able to use the lift. <>\ <>\ <> [[Install the fuse in the box|installfuse1b]] <> [[Install the fuse in the box|installfuse2b]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomB7]]

links.text: Install the fuse in the box
Install the fuse in the box

passages.name: installfuse1b
passages.text: You carefully place the fuse in the right position. <>\ <><>\ Item lost: Fuse [[Back|RoomB7]]

passages.name: installfuse2b
passages.text: You carefully place the fuse in the right position. <>\ <><>\ Item lost: Fuse [[Back|RoomB7]]

passages.name: RoomB11
passages.text:
<>
Lower technical corridor, cave-in
\ <>ODYS: Welcome back, Sandra. You are under section III, by the cave-in. <>ODYS: The tunnel leads deep into the planetoid, through a partially cleared cave-in. Near the pile of rubble there are two six-legged mining robots and an automatic cart. <>ODYS: The tunnel leads deep into the planetoid, through a partially cleared cave-in. Near the pile of rubble there are two six-legged mining robots. <>ODYS: The technical tunnel ends here with a cave-in. A pile of rubble blocks the way. Mixed with the rocks are remains of the tunnel supports. A few metres from the cave-in there is a lock. Near the pile of rubble there is an automatic cart. <>ODYS: The technical tunnel ends here with a cave-in. A pile of rubble blocks the way. Mixed with the rocks are remains of the tunnel supports. A few metres from the cave-in there is a lock. <>\ <>\ <> [[So, the way is blocked?|askaboutdebris]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Examine the cave-in|checkdebris]] <>\ [[Examine the lock|checklockb11]] <> [[Open the valve on the gas bottle|releasegas]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Examine the cart|checkcartb]] <>\ <>\ <><> [[Program the cart|programcartb]] <>\<>\<>\<>\ <> [[Examine the robots|checkrobots]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Go west|lockb11closed]] <> [[Go west|RoomB10][$backtobfromc to false]] <>\ <> <>\ [[Go east|RoomC1]] <>\ [[Go east|intropartC]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Any idea how I could avoid getting lost in the tunnels?|mazeask]] <><>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>

links.text: Open the valve on the gas bottle
Any idea how I could avoid getting lost in the tunnels?

passages.name: askaboutdebris
passages.text: ODYS: Yes. To go further, you need to find some means of clearing the rubble. [[Back|RoomB11]]

passages.name: checkdebris
passages.text: You find large rock fragments, which block the passage completely. You hear noises – shuffling and metal scratching against the rock – from the other side of the cave-in. [[There's something on the other side.|somethingthere]] [[Back|RoomB11]]

links.text: There's something on the other side.

passages.name: somethingthere
passages.text: <>ODYS: Robots. Under normal circumstances, they would be mining for gas in the lower tunnels. It appears their central control system has failed and nothing instructs them what to do. SANDRA: Can I make them clear this rubble? ODYS: I believe it's possible, but you need to find a way to command the robots. Their integral algorithms are rather primitive, I'm afraid. These robots are equipped with vulcanium concentration sensors. If they are not programmed to mine in a particular spot, they bore towards the highest concentration detected, which usually means a gas pocket in the rock. When they reach a pocket, they drill into it, collect the gas and deposit it in one of the underground storage tanks. SANDRA: I see... the gas spread out in the tunnels after the explosion. The robots detect it everywhere around and don't know where to dig. [[Back|RoomB11]] <>ODYS: Robots. Under normal circumstances, they would be mining for gas in the lower tunnels. It appears their central control system has failed and nothing instructs them what to do. <>SANDRA: Can I make them clear this rubble?<> <>ODYS: I believe it's possible, but you need to find a way to command the robots. Their integral algorithms are rather primitive, I'm afraid. These robots are equipped with vulcanium concentration sensors. If they are not programmed to mine in a particular spot, they bore towards the highest concentration detected, which usually means a gas pocket in the rock. When they reach a pocket, they drill into it, collect the gas and deposit it in one of the underground storage tanks.<> <>SANDRA: I see... the gas spread out in the tunnels after the explosion. The robots detect it everywhere around and don't know where to dig.<> <>[[Back|RoomB11]]<> <>\ <>

passages.name: checklockb11
passages.text: <>ODYS: That's an airtight lock, designed to cut off the tunnels from the upper level in case of an emergency. It can be opened and closed with the control buttons. <>ODYS: That is an airtight lock, designed to cut off the tunnels from the upper level in case of an emergency. It's blocked in the open position. The control buttons on both sides of the lock are inactive. On the wall near the lock there is an electrical box. <>\ [[Examine the electrical box|checklockbox]] <> [[Open the lock|openlockb11]] <> [[Close the lock|closelock11b]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomB11]]

passages.name: lockb11closed
passages.text: A shut lock blocks your way. [[Back|RoomB11]]

passages.name: checklockbox
passages.text: You open the cover of the box. <>ODYS: The indicator lights inside the box are on. Power to the lock was restored. <>ODYS: There are no parts missing from the box, but the indicator lights show it is inactive. <>\ <>\ <> [[Try to switch on the power|B11puzzle]] <>\ [[Back|RoomB11]]

links.text: Try to switch on the power

passages.name: B11puzzle
passages.text: <>ODYS: The first lever is in the $lever1name position. The second lever is in the $lever2name position. The third lever is in the $lever3name position. The fourth lever is in the $lever4name position. <>ODYS: There are four lever switches inside the box. The first and the second lever are in the upper position. Their indicator lights are green. The third and the fourth lever are in the lower position. Their indicators are red. I attempted to connect to the box controller, but I only received a fault message. The switches may not work properly. <>\ <>\ [[Switch the first lever|lever1]] [[Switch the second lever|lever2]] [[Switch the third lever|lever3]] [[Switch the fourth lever|lever4]] [[Reset all levers to starting positions|leversreset]] [[Back|RoomB11]]

links.text: Reset all levers to starting positions

passages.name: lever1
passages.text: You switch the lever. <><><>\ <><><>\ <>\ <><><>\ <><><>\ <>\ <><> ODYS: All indicators are now green. You repaired the box! [[Back|checklockb11]] <> [[Back|B11puzzle]] <>\

passages.name: lever2
passages.text: You switch the lever. <><><>\ <><><>\ <>\ <><> ODYS: All indicators are now green. You repaired the box! [[Back|checklockb11]] <> [[Back|B11puzzle]] <>\

passages.name: lever3
passages.text: You switch the lever. <><><>\ <><><>\ <>\ <><><>\ <><><>\ <>\ <><> ODYS: All indicators are now green. You repaired the box! [[Back|checklockb11]] <> [[Back|B11puzzle]] <>\

passages.name: lever4
passages.text: You switch the lever. It immediately switches back. <><><>\ <><><>\ <>\ <><><>\ <><><>\ <>\ <><> ODYS: All indicators are now green. You repaired the box! [[Back|checklockb11]] <> [[Back|B11puzzle]] <>\

passages.name: leversreset
passages.text: You reset the levers. <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|B11puzzle]]

passages.name: openlockb11
passages.text: You press the button. You hear the massive lock open slowly. <>\ [[Back|checklockb11]]

passages.name: closelock11b
passages.text: You press the button. You hear the massive lock slam shut. <>\ [[Back|checklockb11]]

passages.name: releasegas
passages.text: <>Pressurised vulcanium escapes from the bottle and fills the cut-off part of the tunnel. A moment later sounds of hectic movement and drilling start coming from the other side of the cave-in. <>ODYS: The robots started drilling through the rubble. Well done, Sandra!<> <>The sounds grow louder and louder; pieces of rock fall to the floor. You step back to a safe distance. After a few minutes you hear a loud rumble and then the sounds of drilling stop.<> <>ODYS: The robots have cleared a passage through the rubble. You can go down to the tunnels now.<> <><>\ <>[[What about the robots?|robotsask]]<> <>[[Back|RoomB11]]<> <>Pressurised vulcanium escapes from the bottle and disperses in the intensely ventilated tunnel. SANDRA: Oh no... I have to fill the bottle and bring it back here. <>\ [[Back|RoomB11]] <>

passages.name: robotsask
passages.text: ODYS: The gas dispersed when they created a passage through the rubble. The robots stopped moving. [[Back|RoomB11]]

passages.name: intropartC
passages.text: With difficulty you squeeze through a narrow opening in the cave-in. Finally, you get to the other side. <>ODYS: I'm really impressed by your determination, Sandra. So far, you've been doing great.<> <>SANDRA: Are you trying to comfort me?<> <>ODYS: Yes, but that doesn't mean I'm lying. I hope you'll do just as well in the technical tunnels.<> <>SANDRA: I've never been there. Will you guide me?<> <>ODYS: I can't, Sandra. There are no cameras in the tunnels. I would be a blind leading the blind. We won't even hear each other. I'm going to give you all the important information I have, but then you'll be on your own.<> <>SANDRA: Are you telling me to navigate through the tunnels blindly? That's madness.<> <>ODYS: That's your only chance. As long as you stay calm, everything will be all right.<> <>ODYS: The tunnels form a tangled maze, with several large chambers. You must reach the lift which goes up to section II eastern wing. Fortunately, that area escaped significant damage. The lift is blocked on the upper level, but I'll take care of that. However, you must help me first.<> <>SANDRA: Me? Help you?<> <>ODYS: Yes. As I mentioned, my functionality is severely limited. If my functions are unlocked, I will be able to control the lift, among other things. I have a reason to believe that resetting the main power generator will remove the lockdown.<> <>SANDRA: And the generator room can be accessed from the mine tunnels.<> <>ODYS: I see you understand the situation. That's good. Should you need to contact me, just return here.<> <>[[All right. Until then.|intropartCending]] [[I have some questions before I go.|intropartC1]]<>

links.text: I have some questions before I go.

passages.name: checkrobots
passages.text: The mining robots don't react to your presence – at least not in any audible way. ODYS: They won't move until they receive a command from the central control system, or detect an increased concentration of mine gas. [[Back|RoomB11]]

passages.name: mazeask
passages.text: ODYS: Wandering blindly through these tunnels must be a difficult experience. I'm sorry I can't support you any better. I can only offer a suggestion – use senses other than sight. Counting steps and turns can also be helpful – if nothing else, at least you'll be able to get back here. [[Back|RoomB11]]

passages.name: RoomC1
passages.text:
Descending tunnel
\ You are in a rocky tunnel, gently declining to the east. The ground is uneven here. To the west there is a partially cleared cave-in. From the east you hear some muffled noises. [[Listen|c1listen]] [[Go east|RoomC2]] [[Go west|RoomB11][$backtobfromc to true]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>

passages.name: intropartC1
passages.text: ODYS: Of course. [[Can you describe this place to me?|intropartC1_2]] [[What should I expect in the tunnels?|intropartC1_3]] [[Do you at least have an idea which direction should I head in?|intropartC1_4]] [[I have no more questions. Later, Odys.|intropartCending]]

links.text: Can you describe this place to me?
What should I expect in the tunnels?
Do you at least have an idea which direction should I head in?
I have no more questions. Later, Odys.

passages.name: intropartC1_2
passages.text: ODYS: You are in a narrow, descending tunnel drilled in the rock. The ground is uneven. It's semi-dark in here – lamps in the lower tunnels are not working. SANDRA: I'm a bit worried it's dark in there. I know – it's irrational, I can't see anyway. [[Back|intropartC2]]

passages.name: intropartC1_3
passages.text: ODYS: Turns and dead ends, to be sure. You may also run into mining robots. Besides, tunnels near the destroyed gas tank likely collapsed. [[Back|intropartC2]]

passages.name: intropartC1_4
passages.text: ODYS: Of course. The lift to section II is in the north, and the main generator room is located next to the room with the lift. [[Back|intropartC2]]

passages.name: intropartCending
passages.text: ODYS: I'll be waiting. [[Next|RoomC1]]

passages.name: intropartC2
passages.text: [[Can you describe this place to me?|intropartC1_2]] [[What should I expect in the tunnels?|intropartC1_3]] [[Do you at least have an idea which direction should I head in?|intropartC1_4]] [[I have no more questions. Later, Odys.|intropartCending]]

links.text: Can you describe this place to me?
What should I expect in the tunnels?
Do you at least have an idea which direction should I head in?
I have no more questions. Later, Odys.

passages.name: c1listen
passages.text: You listen closely. After a while you begin to distinguish a metallic thudding and a quieter, low buzz. Whatever machines emit these noises, they must be far away. [[Back|RoomC1]]

passages.name: RoomC2
passages.text:
In the technical tunnels
\ You are in a small chamber carved in the rock. Several tunnels exit the room. <>They lead north, north-east, east and west. <>You circle the room with your hand touching the stone wall and discover three more exits, leading north, north-east and east. <>\ <>\ <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the northern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the north-eastern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <>A smell of bourbon is coming from the eastern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <> [[Use bourbon to mark your path|bourbonstart]] <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Spill some bourbon|bourbonc2]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <>\ <>\ [[Listen|c2listen]] [[Go west|RoomC1]] <> [[Go north|RoomC5]] <> [[Go north|cannotentermaze]] <>\ <> [[Go north-east|RoomC6]] <> [[Go north-east|cannotentermaze]] <>\ <> [[Go east|RoomC3]] <> [[Go east|cannotentermaze]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]]

Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away

passages.text:
In the technical tunnels
\ After wandering the tunnels for some time, you reach a chamber carved in rock. It has three exits, leading: north, north-east and south. <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the southern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the northern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the north-eastern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Spill some bourbon|bourbonc5]] <>\ <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <>\ <>\ [[Listen|c5listen]] [[Go north|RoomC8]] [[Go north-east|RoomC9]] [[Go south|RoomC2]] [[Open inventory|Items]]

passages.name: cannotentermaze
passages.text: SANDRA: The maze Odys talked about must begin here. I need to find some way of marking my trail before I go there. A way that works for someone blind. <>\ [[Back|RoomC2]]

passages.name: bourbonstart
passages.text: SANDRA: That's a silly idea. But it might just work. This bourbon has quite a smell – even the breath mask can't block that stench. <>\ [[Back|RoomC2]]

passages.name: bourbonc2
passages.text: You spill some bourbon on the rock floor. <>\ [[Back|RoomC2]]

passages.name: bourbonreset
passages.text: SANDRA: I should start marking my trail anew. <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|$return]]

passages.name: c2listen
passages.text: Quite loud metallic thudding is coming from the east. A barely audible buzz is coming from the north-east. [[Back|RoomC2]]

passages.name: bourbonc3
passages.text: You spill some bourbon on the rock floor. <>\ [[Back|RoomC3]]

passages.name: c3listen
passages.text: Loud metallic thudding is coming from the north-east. A barely audible buzz is coming from the north. [[Back|RoomC3]]

passages.text:
In the technical tunnels
\ You reach another chamber. The metallic noises – thudding, scratching and drilling – are very loud now. Their source must be nearby. The chamber has three exits, leading: north, east and south-west. <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the south-western tunnel. <>\ <>\ <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the northern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Spill some bourbon|bourbonc7]] <>\ <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <>\ <>\ [[Listen|c7listen]] [[Go north|RoomC10]] [[Go east|robotsc7]] [[Go south-west|RoomC3]] [[Open inventory|Items]]

The chamber has two exits, leading: north-west and east. <>You follow a descending corridor and reach a large rock chamber. There are many niches and crevices, large and small, in its walls. passages.name: bourbonc7
passages.text: You spill some bourbon on the rock floor. <>\ [[Back|RoomC7]]

passages.name: c7listen
passages.text: Metallic thudding, deafeningly loud, drowns out all other sounds. There must be mining robots working nearby. [[Back|RoomC7]]

passages.name: RoomC10
passages.text:
In the technical tunnels
\ After wandering the tunnels for some time, you reach a chamber carved in rock. It has two exits, leading: west and south. In the eastern wall there is a niche, about one meter deep. <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the southern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the western tunnel. <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Spill some bourbon|bourbonc10]] <>\ <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <>\ <>\ [[Listen|c10listen]] [[Examine the niche|nichec10]] [[Go west|RoomC9]] [[Go south|RoomC7]] [[Open inventory|Items]]

links.text: Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away

passages.name: robotsc7
passages.text: Heading towards the source of the noises, you approach the robots, working near a tunnel exit. The robots don't react to your presence in any way. [[Examine the robots|checkrobotsc7]] [[Examine the tunnel|checkpassagec7]] [[Go back to the chamber|RoomC7]]

passages.name: checkrobotsc7
passages.text: SANDRA: They must be the same type of robots as those that cleared the cave-in. [[Back|robotsc7]]

passages.name: checkpassagec7
passages.text: The robots are working on the left side of the corridor. You cautiously pass by them, clinging to the right hand wall, and after a few metres you reach a dead end. Apparently this is a new tunnel and the robots have just started drilling it. [[Back|robotsc7]]

passages.name: bourbonc8
passages.text: You spill some bourbon on the rock floor. <>\ [[Back|RoomC8]]

passages.name: c8listen
passages.text: Barely audible metallic thudding is coming from the south. A barely audible buzz is coming from the south. [[Back|RoomC8]]

passages.name: rubblec8
passages.text: Among the rubble you find some bent pieces of metal, which once could have formed the tunnel supports. SANDRA: I think there used to be a tunnel here, leading to the room with the gas tank. It collapsed when the tank exploded. [[Back|RoomC8]]

passages.name: bourbonc9
passages.text: You spill some bourbon on the rock floor. <>\ [[Back|RoomC9]]

passages.name: c9listen
passages.text: Quite loud metallic thudding is coming from the east. A quite loud buzz is coming from the north. [[Back|RoomC9]]

passages.name: RoomC12
passages.text:
In the technical tunnels
\ You reach a room with even floor made of metal panels. A rock tunnel leads south from the room. There are two doors here – in the northern and in the eastern wall. <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the southern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Spill some bourbon|bourbonc12]] <>\ <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <>\ <>\ [[Listen|c12listen]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomC15]] <> [[Go through the eastern door|RoomC14]] <> [[Go through the eastern door|c14closed]] <>\ [[Go south|RoomC9]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.text:
In the technical tunnels
\ After wandering the tunnels for some time, you reach a chamber carved in rock. It has two exits, leading: north-west and south-east. There is a large pile of rubble on the western side of the chamber. <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the south-eastern tunnel. <>\ <>\ <> A smell of bourbon is coming from the north-western tunnel. <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Spill some bourbon|bourbonc11]] <>\ <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <> [[Wait until the smell of bourbon fades away|bourbonreset]] <>\ <>\ [[Listen|c11listen]] [[Examine the rubble|rubblec11]] [[Go north-west|RoomC13]] [[Go south-east|RoomC9]] [[Open inventory|Items]]
