passages.text: <>\ In the doorway you step in something wet. [[Enter the room|RoomD17]] [[There's... some wet stain on the floor here.|itsgrease]]

links.text: There's... some wet stain on the floor here.

passages.name: officeclosed
passages.text: The door is locked. ODYS: Zinov has barricaded himself in the office... I can't open the door. And the camera inside only shows black image. You have to find a way to get inside. <> [[Use the keycard|noopen]] <> [[Use Mulligan's keycard|noopen]] <>\ <>\ [[Press the button on the door|openoffice]] [[Back|RoomD16]]

links.text: Press the button on the door

passages.name: itsgrease
passages.text: ODYS: Yes, I see – it's just oil from a damaged robot. [[Enter the room|RoomD17]]

passages.name: noopen
passages.text: You put the keycard to the panel, but nothing happens. [[Back|officeclosed]]

passages.name: openoffice
passages.text: You press the button. You hear the door open. <>SANDRA: That's one poor barricade.<> <>ODYS: I'm as surprised as you are. Only one explanation comes to my mind – Sasha, an experienced programmer, thought about every IT security measure possible, but forgot this simple mechanical detail. Of course, that's good for us.<> <>\ <>[[Go through the door|findblood]] [[Back|RoomD16]]<>

passages.name: hatchD16
passages.text: ODYS: It's a ventilation duct hatch. It's in the ceiling. There's no ladder leading to it. SANDRA: I can't get there. [[Back|RoomD16]]

passages.name: goleft
passages.text: As you go forward, you step on some small, hard object. You lose your balance and have to support yourself with your hand. You find the object which caused you to stumble. It seems to be a chess piece – a king, judging from its shape. Without really thinking about it, you place it in your pocket. <>Item received: Chess king<> <>You take a few more steps into the room and find a low sideboard. You climb on it and reach up. You quickly locate the camera. The lens is covered up with tape. You remove the tape from the camera.<> <>ODYS: Great – now I can see the room.<> <><>\ <>[[Next|RoomD17]]<>

passages.name: gostraight
passages.text: <>\ You take a few steps into the room and find a desk. There's a computer on it. You start going around the desk and hit a body on the ground with your foot. <>SANDRA: I found Sasha.<> <>ODYS: Sandra, I beg of you, don't wander around. Uncover the camera; we'll think about the rest later.<> <>[[Back|RoomD17]]<>

passages.name: goright
passages.text: <>\ You head right from the door. After a few metres you reach the wall. ODYS: The camera is located to the left from the door, Sandra. There's a sideboard beneath, which you can climb to reach the camera. [[Back|RoomD17]]

passages.name: whycameraoff
passages.text: ODYS: He might have been afraid that the aliens would spot him on the screens in the command centre. [[Back|RoomD17]]

passages.name: sashasbody
passages.text: ODYS: Like the rest of the crew, Sasha died of gas poisoning. He was working on his computer at the moment of his death. [[Search the body|searchsasha]] <> [[I found something here... this must be blood. Where did it come from?|sashasblood]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD17]]

links.text: I found something here... this must be blood. Where did it come from?

passages.name: searchsasha
passages.text: <>SANDRA: There's nothing else here. [[Back|sashasbody]] <>SANDRA: I hope this is the last time. <>You search the body and find a pistol and a keycard. There's a pool of thick liquid by the body.<> <>ODYS: I don't know how Zinov got hold of this weapon, but he was likely planning to use it if the aliens got here. He would probably have shot the first person to come through the door, without thinking twice.<> <>SANDRA: I'd leave the gun here. With things as they are, I could only hurt myself with it.<> <>Item received: Sasha's keycard<> <><>\ <>[[Back|sashasbody]]<> <>

passages.name: king
passages.text: A wooden chess piece. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: sashasblood
passages.text: ODYS: Zinov hit his head on the edge of the desk when he collapsed to the floor. That's why there's blood on the floor. <>\ [[Back|sashasbody]]

passages.name: pcdesk
passages.text: <>ODYS: We've got what we came for. You should go to the command centre ASAP. <>ODYS: You should plug the dongle you found on the desk in the computer. <>ODYS: We need to unlock Sasha's computer and obtain the emergency code. The computer denies my access requests. A message is displayed on the screen which says "Plug in the hardware key to unlock". The key must be here somewhere; Sasha used it frequently. <>\ [[Examine the objects on the desk|deskitems]] [[Back|RoomD17]]

links.text: Examine the objects on the desk

passages.name: deskitems
passages.text: <>ODYS: There is an open notebook here. [[Examine the notebook|sashaspad]] [[Back|pcdesk]] <>ODYS: There is a keycard and an open notebook here. [[Take the keycard|takesantoscard]] [[Examine the notebook|sashaspad]] [[Back|pcdesk]] <>ODYS: On the desk there are: a computer dongle and an open notebook. [[Take the dongle|takedongle]] [[Examine the notebook|sashaspad]] [[Back|pcdesk]] <>ODYS: On the desk there are: a computer dongle, a keycard and an open notebook. [[Take the dongle|takedongle]] [[Take the keycard|takesantoscard]] [[Examine the notebook|sashaspad]] [[Back|pcdesk]] <>

passages.name: sashaspad
passages.text: ODYS: It's open on a page with mathematical diagrams. Zinov used them in his work. [[Back|deskitems]]

passages.name: takesantoscard
passages.text: Item received: Keycard found on Sasha's desk <><>\ [[Back|deskitems]]

passages.name: takedongle
passages.text: ODYS: This must be what we're looking for. Plug it into the computer; there's a port on the side of the keyboard. Item received: Dongle <><>\ [[Back|deskitems]]

passages.name: dongle
passages.text: A hardware key which can be plugged into a computer port. Found on Sasha Zinov's desk. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: dongletopc
passages.text: <><><>\ It takes a few tries, but you manage to plug the dongle in. You hear two beeps. <>Item lost: Dongle<> <>ODYS: You did it! Sasha's computer is no longer locked. Hang on, I'm looking for the code in the system…<> <>ODYS: Got it. The code for sending a distress call is SE1157. You have to input it on the control panel in the command centre and press the confirmation button. I suggest going to the centre right away.<> <><> [[You said Sasha cut his head on the desk, but there's no blood here.|nobloodondesk]] <>\ <>\ [[Next|RoomD17]]<>

links.text: You said Sasha cut his head on the desk, but there's no blood here.

passages.name: nobloodondesk
passages.text: ODYS: Nothing unusual about that. Blood started to pour from the cut a few seconds after he hit the desk. That's why it's on the floor, but not on the desk. [[Next|RoomD17]]

passages.name: congratsd17
passages.text: ODYS: You're almost there, Sandra. We are doing great. At first, I estimated the chances of success at 60%. Now they are close to 100%. With this code you can send a call for help. You must go north, to the command centre in section I. <>\ [[Next|RoomD16]]

passages.name: dontleaved17
passages.text: ODYS: Sandra, wait. You can't leave this room without the code. Finding it is crucial. [[Back|RoomD17]]

passages.name: checksideboard
passages.text: ODYS: There are various personal items on the sideboard – nothing of use to us. There sideboard also has a large drawer. [[Open the drawer|trydrawer]] [[Back|RoomD17]]

passages.name: trydrawer
passages.text: You pull on the handle, but the drawer won't open. [[Back|RoomD17]]

passages.name: checklabdoor
passages.text: <>The door cannot be opened. SANDRA: You can't unlock it, can you? ODYS: No. As long as there's an experiment in progress, the door remains locked. <>\ <> SANDRA: What experiment? ODYS: The large laboratory apparatus is on, and there are some samples prepared on the table. We should investigate this. <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD7]] <>The door cannot be opened. <>SANDRA: You can't unlock it, can you?<> <>ODYS: No. As long as there's an experiment in progress, the door remains locked.<> <>\ <> <>SANDRA: What experiment?<> <>ODYS: The large laboratory apparatus is on, and there are some samples prepared on the table. We should investigate this.<> <>\ <>\ <>[[Back|RoomD7]]<> <> <>

passages.name: askromani
passages.text: ODYS: Yes. I'm sorry, Sandra. <>SANDRA: No, that's not... I mean... I know they are all dead. I... I accepted this.<> <>ODYS: She was your direct superior. Did you like her?<> <>SANDRA: She was a good boss. Though demanding. I… I rather liked her.<> <>\ <>[[Back|RoomD7]]<>

passages.name: checkcoffeemach
passages.text: <>ODYS: It's an automatic cart. On the cart there's a large coffee machine. [[Back|RoomD7]] <>ODYS: It's an automatic cart. On the cart there's a large coffee machine. The machine has independent battery power and a water tank. It's switched on. SANDRA: Instead of just making herself a coffee, Doctor Romani nabbed the entire coffee maker. That's very much like her. Maybe I could use the boiling water from the machine to melt the ice on the northern lock... <>\ [[Back|RoomD7]] <>

passages.name: checklabeq
passages.text: <>ODYS: The apparatus turned off after the experiment was completed. <>ODYS: On the table there is a huge machine, with many switches and status lamps. Three empty containers are placed on its tray. In each container there is a small chunk of rock. The machine is on, waiting for program start. <>[[What was the purpose of this experiment?|exppurpose]] <>[[Running the program should unlock the door. Can you start it?|canstartprogram?]] <>\ <>\ <>[[Do we know where each reagent should go?|whichsubstance]] <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD7]]

links.text: What was the purpose of this experiment?
Running the program should unlock the door. Can you start it?
Do we know where each reagent should go?

passages.name: exppurpose
passages.text: ODYS: Traces of rare metals were detected in samples of rock from the planetoid. Doctor Romani wanted to test which of three different brand reagents is the most efficient in extracting these metals. [[Back|checklabeq]]

passages.name: whichsubstance
passages.text: ODYS: To be honest, it doesn't really matter to us. You may add the reagents in any order – the experiment will still be conducted and the door will open. Adding reagents in order which differs from the calibration will, of course, yield false results, but we need not worry about that. [[You're right. It doesn't matter now.|expignore]] [[Maybe, but I'd like to know anyway. If I'm going to complete Doctor Romani's experiment, I want to do this just like she intended.|expwanttoknow]]

links.text: You're right. It doesn't matter now.
Maybe, but I'd like to know anyway. If I'm going to complete Doctor Romani's experiment, I want to do this just like she intended.

passages.name: canstartprogram?
passages.text: ODYS: The apparatus sends a "not ready" signal. Wait a moment. I'm analysing data from Doctor Romani's computer. <>ODYS: Got it. The apparatus is fully calibrated. However, to start the experiment we need to add reagents.<> <>SANDRA: Do you know what reagents?<> <>ODYS: Even better, they're already prepared in measuring glasses. Doctor Romani was just about to start the procedure when the aliens struck. Luckily for us, she prepared a documentation of the experiment, which describes each step in detail.<> <>\ <>[[Next|checklabeq]]<>

passages.name: expignore
passages.text: ODYS: That's a good decision, Sandra. After all, we only need to open the door. <><>\ [[Back|RoomD7]]

passages.name: expwanttoknow
passages.text: ODYS: As you wish, Sandra, though it makes matters far more complicated. Doctor Romani calibrated the machine and weighed the reagents, but if you want to complete the experiment according to the plan, you have to identify them. ODYS: According to her notes, you need to add a substance called Ennex to the first sample, LIN3 to the second sample and Kalden to the third sample. Their physico-chemical properties are almost identical, but the weighed amounts of each reagent differ, as Doctor Romani has taken into account different size of samples. One of the measuring glasses contains 530ml of Ennex, another one – 450ml of LIN3, and the last one – 540ml of Kalden. The glasses are placed in a row, but I don't know if that's the order in which the reagents are to be added. <><>\ [[Back|RoomD7]]

passages.name: moreaboutexp
passages.text: <>[[Can you tell me what was Doctor Romani's plan, after all?|donotignore]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Tell me again, what should I add where if I want to get correct results?|expremind]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Did Doctor Romani mention the expected results in her notes?|results?]] <>\ <>\ <> [[The procedure seems simple enough, but how can I identify the reagents?|howidentify]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD7]]

links.text: Can you tell me what was Doctor Romani's plan, after all?
Tell me again, what should I add where if I want to get correct results?
Did Doctor Romani mention the expected results in her notes?
The procedure seems simple enough, but how can I identify the reagents?

passages.name: donotignore
passages.text: ODYS: You might have a point here, though your safety is more important now. Still, it won't hurt us, as long as you complete the experiment quickly enough. All right, I'll give you all the information I found. Doctor Romani calibrated the machine and weighed the reagents, but if you want to complete the experiment according to the plan, you have to identify them. ODYS: According to her notes, you need to add a substance called Ennex to the first sample, LIN3 to the second sample and Kalden to the third sample. Their physico-chemical properties are almost identical, but the weighed amounts of each reagent differ, as Doctor Romani has taken into account different size of samples. One of the measuring glasses contains 530ml of Ennex, another one – 450ml of LIN3, and the last one – 540ml of Kalden. The glasses are placed in a row, but I don't know if that's the order in which the reagents are to be added. <><>\ [[Back|moreaboutexp]]

passages.name: expremind
passages.text: ODYS: Sample 1: Ennex, 530ml. Sample 2: LIN3, 450ml. Sample 3: Kalden 540ml. [[Back|moreaboutexp]]

passages.name: results?
passages.text: ODYS: Yes. She expected Ennex to be the most efficient, and Kalden to be the least efficient. [[Back|moreaboutexp]]

passages.name: howidentify
passages.text: ODYS: I don't know. I suggest you don't worry about the correct order. It won't matter at all if the results are incorrect and, let's say, show Ennex is the optimal reagent instead of LIN3. <>\ <> SANDRA: Wait a minute – you can see the measuring glasses! Can you tell me how much liquid there is in each of them? ODYS: No, Sandra. I'm viewing them from above and can't see the small differences in fluid level. You must find another way to identify the reagents. <>\ <>\ [[Back|moreaboutexp]]

passages.name: dothescience
passages.text: You approach the laboratory table and locate three measuring glasses. [[Weigh the glasses in your hands|checkmass]] [[Smell the reagents|smell]] <> [[Tap each glass with the spoon|sounds]] <>\ <>\ [[Tell me again, what should I add where if I want to get correct results?|scienceremind]] [[Add reagents to samples|addreagents]] [[Back|RoomD7]]

links.text: Weigh the glasses in your hands
Tap each glass with the spoon
Tell me again, what should I add where if I want to get correct results?

passages.name: checkmass
passages.text: You pick up the measuring glasses, one by one. Even if the first and the second one differ in weight, you can't tell the difference. The third glass, however, seems lighter. [[Back|dothescience]]

passages.name: smell
passages.text: None of the reagents smells of anything. [[Back|dothescience]]

passages.name: sounds
passages.text: You cautiously tap the glasses with the teaspoon. The first glass emits a low sound. The second glass emits a slightly higher sound. The sound of the third glass is significantly higher. [[Back|dothescience]]

passages.name: scienceremind
passages.text: ODYS: Sample 1: Ennex, 530ml. Sample 2: LIN3, 450ml. Sample 3: Kalden 540ml. [[Back|dothescience]]

passages.name: addreagents
passages.text: SANDRA: Once I add the reagents, I won't be able to change it... [[Add the reagents|yesadd]] [[Back|dothescience]]

passages.name: yesadd
passages.text: Add the reagent in the first glass to which sample? [[First sample|kaldento1]] [[Second sample|kaldento2]] [[Third sample|kaldento3]]

passages.name: kaldento1
passages.text: <><>\ Add the reagent in the second glass to which sample? <>\ <> [[First sample|ennexto1]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Second sample|ennexto2]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Third sample|ennexto3]] <>\

passages.name: kaldento2
passages.text: <><>\ Add the reagent in the second glass to which sample? <>\ <> [[First sample|ennexto1]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Second sample|ennexto2]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Third sample|ennexto3]] <>\

passages.name: kaldento3
passages.text: <><>\ Add the reagent in the second glass to which sample? <>\ <> [[First sample|ennexto1]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Second sample|ennexto2]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Third sample|ennexto3]] <>\

passages.name: ennexto1
passages.text: <><>\ Add the reagent in the third glass to which sample? <>\ <> [[First sample|lin3to1]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Second sample|lin3to2]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Third sample|lin3to3]] <>\

passages.name: ennexto2
passages.text: <><>\ Add the reagent in the third glass to which sample? <>\ <> [[First sample|lin3to1]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Second sample|lin3to2]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Third sample|lin3to3]] <>\

passages.name: ennexto3
passages.text: <><>\ Add the reagent in the third glass to which sample? <>\ <> [[First sample|lin3to1]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Second sample|lin3to2]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Third sample|lin3to3]] <>\

passages.name: lin3to1
passages.text: <><>\ You pour reagents from the measuring glasses into the sample containers. ODYS: Now I can start the processing. [[Next|processexp]]

passages.name: lin3to2
passages.text: <><>\ You pour reagents from the measuring glasses into the sample containers. ODYS: Now I can start the processing. [[Next|processexp]]

passages.name: lin3to3
passages.text: <><>\ You pour reagents from the measuring glasses into the sample containers. ODYS: Now I can start the processing. [[Next|processexp]]

passages.name: processexp
passages.text: <>\ <><><>\<>\ You hear the laboratory apparatus humming to life. The machine continues making noise for a few minutes, then goes quiet. ODYS: Great – the door was unlocked. And I have the results of our experiment. Do you want me to read them out? [[Sure!|expresults]] [[No. I'd rather focus on getting to Sasha's office.|RoomD7]]

links.text: No. I'd rather focus on getting to Sasha's office.

passages.name: expresults
passages.text: ODYS: The experiment shows that <>Ennex<>LIN3<>Kalden<> is the most effective reagent. The least effective one is <>Ennex.<>LIN3.<>Kalden.<> <> Of course, I can't confirm if you identified the reagents correctly, but the results agree with Doctor Romani's expectations. <>SANDRA: I think I got it right, but it was pure luck. ODYS: Indeed, you were lucky. But the important thing is, we managed to get that door open. <>SANDRA: I'm sure I did it right. ODYS: You're certainly inventive, Sandra. The important thing is, the lab door is now unlocked. <>\ [[Next|RoomD7]] <> Of course, I can't confirm if you identified the reagents correctly, especially because our results don't agree with Doctor Romani's expectations. SANDRA: I think I messed this up. ODYS: Or maybe Doctor Romani was wrong. It doesn't matter, Sandra – I can open the lab door now, and, after all, that's what we wanted. [[Next|RoomD7]] <>

passages.name: searchromani
passages.text: ODYS: Like the rest of the crew, Doctor Romani died of gas poisoning. At the moment of her death she was typing on the computer, finishing her preparations for the experiment. SANDRA: She was very methodical. For every process, there had to be paperwork filled out – before, during and after. She must have been so focused on her work she didn't realise what was going on until the very last moment. <> [[Search the body|romaninothing]] <> [[Search the body|takeknife]] <>\ [[Back|RoomD7]]

passages.name: romaninothing
passages.text: SANDRA: Doctor Romani had nothing but a lab knife with her. [[Back|RoomD7]]

passages.name: takeknife
passages.text: In a pocket of Doctor Romani's lab coat you find a small knife. Item received: Knife <>\ [[Back|RoomD7]]

passages.name: checkreagents
passages.text: ODYS: On the shelves there are rows of labelled bottles, jars and other containers, and various laboratory equipment. SANDRA: I'd better not touch them – Doctor Romani keeps some nasty chemicals there. I don't want them to drop on my head. [[Back|RoomD7]]

passages.name: chuteno
passages.text: SANDRA: I won't crawl through the duct again – I can go right through the door. [[Back|RoomD7]]

passages.name: gladyouleft
passages.text: ODYS: I'm glad you've used common sense. I'll lock that door. Let's go – there's no time to waste. [[Back|RoomD10]]

passages.name: goinside
passages.text: <>Going through the room, you find a desk to your left. [[Examine the desk|meddesk]] [[Go to the back of the room|gofurther]] [[Back|RoomD14]] <>ODYS: I beg you, don't ignore my warnings. You came so far. Please, don't put your life at risk. <>Going through the room, you find a desk to your left.<> <>[[Examine the desk|meddesk]] [[Go to the back of the room|gofurther]] [[Back|RoomD14]]<> <>\ <>

links.text: Go to the back of the room

passages.name: checkmedstation
passages.text: <>The machine you touch is some kind of cabin. Its door is open. There's a row of buttons on the side of the cabin. ODYS: This is a spray lubrication cabin for humanoid robots. The oil used in there is highly toxic in contact with the skin. [[Examine the buttons|checkmedpanel]] [[Step into the cabin|entermedstation]] [[Back|RoomD14]] <>ODYS: Why are you ignoring me? I only think about your safety; alas, I have no way of stopping you if you won't listen. You must be rational. You must listen to me. I don't want to fail you, not even by your own wish. <>The machine you touch is some kind of cabin. Its door is open. There's a row of buttons on the side of the cabin.<> <>ODYS: This is a spray lubrication cabin for humanoid robots. The oil used in there is highly toxic in contact with the skin.<> <>[[Examine the buttons|checkmedpanel]] [[Step into the cabin|entermedstation]] [[Back|RoomD14]]<> <>\ <>\

passages.name: meddesk
passages.text: <><>On the desk there's a computer monitor and a kind of rack, in which six small, cylindrical objects are placed. <>On the desk there's a computer monitor and a kind of rack, in which five small, cylindrical objects are placed. There's a slot in the rack for a sixth object. <>\ <> [[Place the cylinder in the rack|cylinderin]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|insideamb]] <>On the desk there's a computer monitor and a kind of rack, in which five small, cylindrical objects are placed. There's a slot in the rack for a sixth object. <>ODYS: It's an unpowered diagnostic station and spare robot AI cores. Nothing useful. Please, Sandra, turn back before you hurt yourself.<> <><> [[Place the cylinder in the rack|cylinderin]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|insideamb]]<> <>\ <>\

links.text: Place the cylinder in the rack

passages.name: cylinderin
passages.text: You put the cylinder in the slot. It fits perfectly. ODYS: It's great that you returned that AI core, but this doesn't get us anywhere. <><><>\ [[Back|meddesk]]

passages.name: insideamb
passages.text: You are near the desk in the middle of the room. [[Examine the desk|meddesk]] [[Go to the back of the room|gofurther]] [[Back|RoomD14]]

links.text: Go to the back of the room

passages.name: gofurther
passages.text: <>You pass by the desk and approach the machinery at the back of the room. [[Examine the machinery|checkmedeq]] [[Back|insideamb]] <>You pass by the desk and approach the machinery at the back of the room. <>ODYS: I've managed to cut off power to these stations, but I get dozens of error messages. Power may go back on at any given moment. You must leave this room before that happens.<> <>[[Examine the machinery|checkmedeq]] [[Back|insideamb]]<> <>\ <>\

passages.name: checkmedeq
passages.text: <>There is a vertical machine with many dangling wires here, a massive contraption on a robotic arm and a bench covered with soft fake leather. [[Back|insideamb]] <>There is a vertical machine with many dangling wires here, a massive contraption on a robotic arm and a bench covered with soft fake leather. <>ODYS: Do you really have to touch everything? You're like a small child. But the "toys" you play with are dangerous.<> <>[[You're right. I'm sorry. I'm leaving this room right now.|gladyouleft]] [[Back|insideamb]]<> <>\ <>\

links.text: You're right. I'm sorry. I'm leaving this room right now.

passages.name: checkmedpanel
passages.text: You find a button which is bigger than the others and has a cross etched on it. <>\ <> [[Press the button with the cross|diagnosison]] <>\ [[Back|checkmedstation]]

links.text: Press the button with the cross

passages.name: entermedstation
passages.text: <>ODYS: Sandra? Sandra, are you listening? Leave that cabin at once, do you hear? Leave it at once! [[Leave the cabin|leavemedstation]] [[Stay in the cabin|stayinstation]] <>ODYS: You're crazy. Are you trying to kill yourself? Just hear me out. You've almost there. Do not despair. I will help you. I won't let you come to harm. <>ODYS: Sandra? Sandra, are you listening? Leave that cabin at once, do you hear? Leave it at once!<> <>[[Leave the cabin|leavemedstation]] [[Stay in the cabin|stayinstation]]<> <>\ <>You enter the cabin, but nothing happens. The machine is turned off. You step out of the cabin. [[Next|checkmedstation]] <>\

passages.name: diagnosison
passages.text: The machinery emits a series of crackling noises. You hear a robotic female voice: <>VOICE: Automatic diagnosis started. Please enter the cabin.<> <>ODYS: These instructions are not meant for humans. You are not a robot. You should step back.<> <>\ <>[[Back|checkmedstation]]<>

passages.name: leavemedstation
passages.text: ODYS: Thank you, Sandra. Let's leave this place. [[Next|RoomD14]]

passages.name: stayinstation
passages.text: You step into the cabin. You hear the door close behind you. <>VOICE: Vulcanium concentration above limit detected in the air. Creating protective atmosphere in the cabin.<> <>You feel a strong airflow.<> <>VOICE: Creating protective atmosphere completed. Please take off the breath mask.<> <>You slowly take off the breath mask. The air in the cabin smells of disinfectants. You hear a ventilator working. The cabin blocks all sounds from the outside. Even if Odys is talking to you right now, you can't hear him.<> <>VOICE: Preliminary diagnosis completed. Second degree vulcanium poisoning detected. Commencing routine detoxification. Please stand still and breath deeply.<> <>SANDRA: "Lack of reason"? Yes, I was foolish to trust Odys...<> <>Different substances are vented into the cabin one by one. The air smells sour and burns you in the nose. You feel a pleasant warmth on your face. Suddenly a needle pricks the skin on your forearm.<> <>VOICE: Detoxification completed. Caution: vulcanium concentration above limit outside of the cabin. Please put on your breath mask before leaving the cabin.<> <>You put on the mask. The door of the cabin slides open when you touch it. You step out. You feel dizzy and your hands shake with adrenaline – or maybe that's a side effect of the treatment.<> <>All around you there is light, dim and milky, and various shapes begin to emerge from it.<> <><>\ <>[[Next|d14!prologue]]<>

passages.name: RoomD14!
passages.text:
Section II, medical room
 <>
You are in the medical room. The only door is in the western wall of the room. To the right from the door there is an automatic first aid station. To the left there is a desk. At the back of the room there is a couch, surrounded by various medical devices. [[Examine the cabin|checkcabind14!]] [[Examine the desk|checkdeskd14!]] [[Go through the western door|RoomD10!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <> <>
<> <>You are in the medical room. The only door is in the western wall of the room. To the right from the door there is an automatic first aid station. To the left there is a desk. At the back of the room there is a couch, surrounded by various medical devices.<> <>[[Examine the cabin|checkcabind14!]]<> <>[[Examine the desk|checkdeskd14!]]<> <>[[Go through the western door|RoomD10!]]<> <>[[Open inventory|Items]]<> <><><><><> <>\ <>\

passages.name: shouldhide
passages.text: ODYS: You could, but if you don't alarm the emergency services, nobody will come to your aid. I have no idea what the aliens are going to do, but we have to assume that they will search the station. Or that they will take what they want and then bombard us. <>SANDRA: What can I do, then?<> <>ODYS: As I mentioned, I have a plan.<> <>[[Next|theplan]]<>

passages.name: candefend
passages.text: ODYS: You can. You can use the station against them. And this precisely is my plan. [[Next|theplan]]

passages.name: theplan
passages.text: ODYS: I blocked the lock between the docking module and section I main corridor, but the Outworlders will eventually force their way through. We must kill them before that happens. <>SANDRA: Kill them?! But how?<> <>ODYS: There's a cable assembly which runs under the ceiling of the lock where I trapped the aliens. I've made some calculations – if we apply enough voltage to the assembly, the insulation will fail and the metal room will turn into a deadly electric trap. There's only one problem – the fuse. If I redirect the electric current now, it will blow and the circuit will be broken. You have to get to the fuse box, which is in a room right before the command centre, and replace the main section I fuse with one that can stand the load.<> <>[[I'll do this. They are going to pay for murdering the crew.|wantrevenge]]<> <>[[I've never thought I'll have to kill...|dontwanttokill]]<> <>[[What if your plan doesn't work?|whatifplanfails]]<>

links.text: I'll do this. They are going to pay for murdering the crew.
I've never thought I'll have to kill...
What if your plan doesn't work?

passages.name: wantrevenge
passages.text: ODYS: You must do this, first and foremost, for your own safety, Sandra. But it doesn't surprise me you want justice to be served. [[Next|gointof]]

passages.name: dontwanttokill
passages.text: ODYS: I'm afraid you have no choice, Sandra. They will show you no mercy. Remember they have blood of your friends on their hands. [[Next|gointof]]

passages.name: whatifplanfails
passages.text: ODYS: Then you'll be in great danger. But there's no reason to believe my plan will fail. I've calculated everything; the trap will work, but you must hurry and replace the fuse before the aliens force their way through the lock. [[Next|gointof]]

passages.name: gointof
passages.text: ODYS: You should head straight now and turn left at the lock. You'll find a small room with the main fuse box. Do you have any questions? [[I didn't think they would come back. I'm afraid.|afraid]] [[Did you realise that the aliens might return?|knowreturn]] [[Describe the plan of this section to me.|mapoff]] [[I have no more questions.|endingintrof]]

links.text: I didn't think they would come back. I'm afraid.
Did you realise that the aliens might return?
Describe the plan of this section to me.

passages.name: afraid
passages.text: ODYS: As I've already mentioned, they surely want to plunder the station. It's only natural that you're afraid, but if you act decisively, you will come to no harm. Please, trust me and do as I say. [[Back|gointof2]]

passages.name: knowreturn
passages.text: ODYS: I knew there was such a possibility, but I decided not to tell you. Otherwise this threat would have been on your mind all the time, petrifying you, making you unable to act. [[Back|gointof2]]

passages.name: mapoff
passages.text: ODYS: Section I isn't large. You are in a straight corridor, which goes through a multimedia room, to the docking module lock. By the lock the corridor turns left and continues west to the command centre. Right before the command centre there is the room with the main fuse box. [[Back|gointof2]]

passages.name: endingintrof
passages.text: ODYS: All right, then. Move on. Don't worry – I'll keep you informed on the situation. For now, the aliens haven't found a way of getting out of the trap. [[Next|RoomF1]]

passages.name: gointof2
passages.text: [[I didn't think they would come back. I'm afraid.|afraid]] [[Did you realise that the aliens might return?|knowreturn]] [[Describe the plan of this section to me.|mapoff]] [[I have no more questions.|endingintrof]]

links.text: I didn't think they would come back. I'm afraid.
Did you realise that the aliens might return?
Describe the plan of this section to me.

passages.name: RoomF1
passages.text:
<>
Corridor by the lift
\ ODYS: You are on the southern end of section I corridor. The corridor leads north. To the south there is a lift down to section II. Next to the lift door, by the western wall, several pipes with service valves are coming through the floor. The pipes bend and run along the corridor, under the ceiling. <>\ [[Take the lift down to section II|noreturntod]] <> [[Take the lift down to section II|RoomD16]] <>\ [[Examine the pipe valves|checkvalvesf1]] [[Go north|RoomF2]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>
Corridor by the lift
\ ODYS: You are on the southern end of section I corridor. The corridor leads north. To the south there is a lift down to section II. Next to the lift door, by the western wall, several pipes with service valves are coming through the floor. The pipes bend and run along the corridor, under the ceiling. <><>\ [[Take the lift down to section II|noreturntod]] <> [[Take the lift down to section II|RoomD16]] <>\ [[Examine the pipe valves|checkvalvesf1]] [[Go north|RoomF2]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><><> <>\ <>\

links.text: Take the lift down to section II
Take the lift down to section II

passages.name: noreturntod
passages.text: ODYS: We have no reason to go back there. You must send the distress signal ASAP, so that help comes before structural damage to station causes decompression. [[Back|RoomF1]]

passages.name: checkvalvesf1
passages.text: ODYS: Those pipes carry water and vulcanium. Tampering with the valves could lead to an accident. [[Back|RoomF1]]

passages.name: RoomF2
passages.text:
<>
Section I corridor
\ You hear metallic clattering and grating coming through the eastern wall of the corridor. ODYS: You are in the southern corridor of section I. To the north there is a massive door. The corridor goes south. [[What are these noises?|noisesf2]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomF3]] [[Go south|RoomF1]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>
Section I corridor
\ You hear metallic clattering and grating coming through the eastern wall of the corridor. <>ODYS: You are in the southern corridor of section I. To the north there is a massive door. The corridor goes south.<> <>[[What are these noises?|noisesf2]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomF3]] [[Go south|RoomF1]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><><> <>\ <>\

passages.name: noisesf2
passages.text: ODYS: Upper mining tunnels are running behind this wall. You hear the robots working. [[Back|RoomF2]]

passages.name: RoomF3
passages.text:
<>
Information centre
\ <>ODYS: You are in an octagonal room. There are broken, sparkling screens under the ceiling, and a charred control panel below. There are cushioned seats against the walls. There are two doors in the room, leading north and south. <>ODYS: You are in an octagonal room. In the middle of the room there are four large screens, facing four directions, and below the screens there is a control panel. The screens are turned off. There are cushioned seats against the walls. There are two doors in the room, leading north and south. <>\ [[Isn't the command centre farther away?|centerfurther]] <> [[Go to the control panel|consoledestroyed]] <> [[Go to the control panel|consolef3]] <>\ <> [[Go through the northern door|explosionnorth]] <> [[Go through the northern door|RoomF5]] <>\ <> [[Go through the southern door|explosionsouth]] <> [[Go through the southern door|RoomF2]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>
Information centre
\ <>ODYS: You are in an octagonal room. There are broken, sparkling screens under the ceiling, and a charred control panel below. There are cushioned seats against the walls. There are two doors in the room, leading north and south. <>ODYS: You are in an octagonal room. In the middle of the room there are four large screens, facing four directions, and below the screens there is a control panel. The screens are turned off. There are cushioned seats against the walls. There are two doors in the room, leading north and south. <>\ <>[[Isn't the command centre farther away?|centerfurther]] <> [[Go to the control panel|consoledestroyed]] <> [[Go to the control panel|consolef3]] <>\ <> [[Go through the northern door|explosionnorth]] <> [[Go through the northern door|RoomF5]] <>\ <> [[Go through the southern door|explosionsouth]] <> [[Go through the southern door|RoomF2]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><><> <>\ <>

links.text: Isn't the command centre farther away?

passages.name: centerfurther
passages.text: ODYS: Yes, it's at the end of the section. You are in the information centre now. [[Back|RoomF3]]

passages.name: explosionnorth
passages.text: As you approach the door you hear a loud, crashing noise and the sound of glass falling to the floor. <>ODYS: That's not good... I didn't expect that. The info screens have just exploded, Sandra. We're lucky you weren't standing anywhere near. I hope it was just a malfunction, not a sign that the aliens managed to break into our system. We've no time to waste – go now!<> <>\ <>[[Go north|RoomF5]]<>

passages.name: RoomF5
passages.text:
<>
Corridor by the docking module lock
\ <>\ <> You hear a loud noise coming from the north, as if someone was banging on the door. <>\ <>ODYS: You are in a corridor. There is a door to the south and a lock to the north. Inside the lock there are four dead, charred bodies of Outworlders and a broken cutter. The corridor turns west by the lock. [[Go west|RoomF6]] [[Go through the southern door|RoomF3]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>ODYS: You are in a corridor. To the south there is a door, and to the north there is the lock in which the aliens are trapped. The corridor turns west. [[What do the aliens look like? How many of them are there?|aliensdescr]] <> [[Go west|RoomF6]] <> [[Go west|aliensreact]] <>\ [[Go through the southern door|RoomF3]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>ODYS: To the south there is a door, and to the north there is the lock in which the aliens are trapped. The lock has a large window; they can see you, Sandra. Don't be afraid, they can't hurt you now. You have to go west and locate the fuse box. <>\ <>[[I don't know if I can do this. They... I…|idontknow]] [[(say nothing)|saynothing]]<> <>\

links.text: What do the aliens look like? How many of them are there?
I don't know if I can do this. They... I…

passages.name: explosionsouth
passages.text: As you approach the door you hear a loud, crashing noise and the sound of glass falling to the floor. <>ODYS: That's not good... I didn't expect that. The info screens have just exploded, Sandra. We're lucky you weren't standing anywhere near. I hope it was just a malfunction, not a sign that the aliens managed to break into our system. We've no time to waste – go now!<> <>\ <>[[Go south|RoomF2]]<>

passages.name: consoledestroyed
passages.text: ODYS: The panel is now only a pile of charred plastic and wires. [[Back|RoomF3]]

passages.name: consolef3
passages.text: You approach the control panel in the middle of the room. There are several large buttons on it. ODYS: This panel was used to switch between camera views, showing different rooms on the station. It's nothing we could make use of now. [[Press a button|buttonsf3]] [[Step back from the panel|RoomF3]]

passages.name: buttonsf3
passages.text: The letters on the buttons are raised – you can decipher them with your fingertips. [[Press the button labelled "Command centre"|buttoncommand]] [[Press the button labelled "Docking platform"|buttondock]] [[Press the button labelled "Canteen"|buttoncantina]] [[Press the button labelled "Medical room"|buttonamb]] [[Press the button labelled "Reactor room"|buttonreactor]] [[Press the button labelled "Crew quarters – intersection"|buttonintersect]] [[Step back from the panel|RoomF3]]

links.text: Press the button labelled "Crew quarters – intersection"

passages.name: buttoncommand
passages.text: <>You press the button and sound starts coming from speakers above your head. ODYS: I see no reason to play with this, Sandra. You shouldn't waste time. <><>\ <><><><>\ A quiet hum of ventilation is coming through the speakers. [[Back|buttonsf3]]

passages.name: buttondock
passages.text: <>You press the button and sound starts coming from speakers above your head. ODYS: I see no reason to play with this, Sandra. You shouldn't waste time. <><>\ <><><><>\ You hear the hum of pumps working. [[Back|buttonsf3]]

passages.name: buttoncantina
passages.text: <>You press the button and sound starts coming from speakers above your head. ODYS: I see no reason to play with this, Sandra. You shouldn't waste time. <><>\ <><><><>\ You hear the buzzing of broken food machines. <> You can also hear music.<><> [[Back|buttonsf3]]

passages.name: buttonamb
passages.text: <>You press the button and sound starts coming from speakers above your head. ODYS: I see no reason to play with this, Sandra. You shouldn't waste time. <><>\ <><><><>\ You hear a monotonous buzz of machinery and a rhythmic, beeping noise. [[Back|buttonsf3]]

passages.name: buttonreactor
passages.text: <>You press the button and sound starts coming from speakers above your head. ODYS: I see no reason to play with this, Sandra. You shouldn't waste time. <><>\ <><><><>\ A loud, vibrating buzz is coming through the speakers. [[Back|buttonsf3]]

passages.name: buttonintersect
passages.text: <>You press the button and sound starts coming from speakers above your head. ODYS: I see no reason to play with this, Sandra. You shouldn't waste time. <><>\ <><><><>\ A quiet hum of ventilation is coming through the speakers. [[Back|buttonsf3]]

passages.name: idontknow
passages.text: ODYS: I know too well what they did. Hurry up, or they're going to kill you as well. They are trapped, Sandra. You must act before they force their way through the lock. [[How much time do I have?|howmuchtime]] [[I... understand.|RoomF5]]

links.text: How much time do I have?

passages.name: saynothing
passages.text: ODYS: Be brave, Sandra. We'll get through this. [[Back|RoomF5]]

passages.name: howmuchtime
passages.text: ODYS: The longer we speak, the less. One of the aliens is trying to start an automatic cutter now. [[Next|RoomF5]]

passages.name: aliensdescr
passages.text: ODYS: Does it really matter to you? … Fine. Four of them. They're about two metres tall and thinner than an average human. They are wearing full spacesuits with helmets. [[Back|RoomF5]]

passages.name: RoomF6
passages.text:
<>
Corridor by the command centre
\ <>ODYS: This corridor leads west, to the command centre. To the east there is the docking module lock. In the northern wall of the corridor there is a narrow door with an electrical warning triangle. <>ODYS: This corridor goes west, to the command centre. To the east there is the docking module lock. In the northern wall of the corridor there is a narrow door with an electrical warning triangle. You must go through that door to replace the fuse. <>\ <> [[Go through the northern door|RoomF4]] <> [[Go through the northern door|f4firsttime]] <>\ <> [[Go west|RoomF7]] <> [[Go west|openF7]] <> [[Go west|noopenf7]] <>\ [[Go east|RoomF5]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>
Corridor by the command centre
\ <>ODYS: This corridor leads west, to the command centre. To the east there is the docking module lock. In the northern wall of the corridor there is a narrow door with an electrical warning triangle. <>ODYS: This corridor goes west, to the command centre. To the east there is the docking module lock. In the northern wall of the corridor there is a narrow door with an electrical warning triangle. You must go through that door to replace the fuse. <>\ <><> [[Go through the northern door|RoomF4]] <> [[Go through the northern door|f4firsttime]] <>\ <> [[Go west|RoomF7]] <> [[Go west|openF7]] <> [[Go west|noopenf7]] <>\ [[Go east|RoomF5]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><><> <>\ <>

passages.name: aliensreact
passages.text: As you approach the lock, the noises get louder and more frantic. You also hear muffled shouts. <>ODYS: Just ignore them, Sandra. They can't do anything to you.<> <>You go on, paying no attention to the noises.<> <>\ <>[[Next|RoomF6]]<>

passages.name: RoomF4
passages.text:
<>
Room with the fuse box
\ ODYS: You are in a tiny room. There is a yellow fuse box here. The only door in the room leads south. <> [[Open the fuse box|openboxf4]] <> [[Open the fuse box|boxf4closed]] <>\ <> [[Use socket wrench to unlock the fuse box door|unlockboxf4]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Go through the southern door|RoomF6]] <> [[Go through the southern door|noleavef4]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>
Room with the fuse box
\ ODYS: You are in a tiny room. There is a yellow fuse box here. The only door in the room leads south. <><> [[Open the fuse box|openboxf4]] <> [[Open the fuse box|boxf4closed]] <>\ <> [[Use socket wrench to unlock the fuse box door|unlockboxf4]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Go through the southern door|RoomF6]] <> [[Go through the southern door|noleavef4]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><><> <>\ <>

links.text: Use socket wrench to unlock the fuse box door

passages.name: noopenf7
passages.text: The door to the command centre is locked. ODYS: First we have to eliminate the aliens. If they get through the lock, no distress call will bring help quickly enough. [[Back|RoomF6]]

passages.name: RoomF7
passages.text:
<>
Command centre
\ ODYS: You are in the command centre. It is a large circular room with partially glass walls. There are several control panels here. On the chair in front of the central panel there is a body of a man. <>\ <> ODYS: You've made it, Sandra. Now you only have to input the code using the central panel and confirm it with a button. <>\ <>\ [[This man must be the captain?|askcaptain]] [[What happens when I've sent the code?|asksendcode]] [[Do you think more Outworlders may come?|askmorealiens]] [[Go to the central control panel|centralPC]] [[Leave the command centre|noleavef7]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>
Command centre
\ ODYS: You are in the command centre. It is a large circular room with partially glass walls. There are several control panels here. On the chair in front of the central panel there is a body of a man. <>\ <> ODYS: You've made it, Sandra. Now you only have to input the code using the central panel and confirm it with a button. <>\ <>\ <>[[This man must be the captain?|askcaptain]] [[What happens when I've sent the code?|asksendcode]] [[Do you think more Outworlders may come?|askmorealiens]] [[Go to the central control panel|centralPC]] [[Leave the command centre|noleavef7]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><><> <>\ <>\

links.text: This man must be the captain?
What happens when I've sent the code?
Do you think more Outworlders may come?
Go to the central control panel

passages.name: openF7
passages.text: ODYS: Wait, I'll open the command centre door for you. You hear the door slide open. <>\ [[Go through the door|RoomF7]] [[Back|RoomF6]]

passages.name: f4firsttime
passages.text: Suddenly you hear a strange, vibrating noise coming from the corridor. ODYS: They've started cutting their way through. Hurry! <>\ [[Next|RoomF4]]

passages.name: openboxf4
passages.text: You open the box. <>ODYS: All key systems are operational. You don't have to switch the fuses again. [[Back|RoomF4]] <>ODYS: There is a row of four fuses in the top part of the box. You have to replace the first fuse from the left with the third one. The first one is section I main fuse, the third one is for the upper mine level. <>\ <> [[Take out the first fuse|takeoutfuse1]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Take out the third fuse|takeoutfuse3]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Use the keycard to lever out the third fuse|pickfuse3]] <> [[Use the keycard to lever out the third fuse|pickfuse3]] <> [[Use the keycard to lever out the third fuse|pickfuse3]] <> [[Use the keycard to lever out the third fuse|pickfuse3]] <> [[Use the keycard to lever out the third fuse|pickfuse3]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Place the light fuse in the third holder from the left|burnfuse]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Place the heavy fuse in the first holder from the left|placefuse]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomF4]] <>

links.text: Use the keycard to lever out the third fuse
Place the light fuse in the third holder from the left
Place the heavy fuse in the first holder from the left

passages.name: boxf4closed
passages.text: The door of the fuse box is locked. There is a round socket in it. [[Back|RoomF4]]

passages.name: takeoutfuse1
passages.text: You manage to find and take out the first fuse. It's a light cylinder, no longer than your thumb. As you remove it from the holder, you hear a short signal coming from the corridor. ODYS: We switched to emergency power. No need to worry about that. Item received: Light fuse <><>\ [[Back|openboxf4]]

passages.name: takeoutfuse3
passages.text: You try to remove the fuse, but it's stuck in its holder. SANDRA: I need something to lever it out. <>\ [[Back|openboxf4]]

passages.name: lightfuse
passages.text: A smooth cylinder with contacts on both ends. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: heavyfuse
passages.text: A smooth cylinder with contacts on both ends. It's small, but considerably heavy. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: pickfuse3
passages.text: You press the keycard between the fuse and the holder. You manage to lever out the fuse. It's a heavy cylinder, no longer than your thumb. Item received: Heavy fuse <><>\ [[Back|openboxf4]]

passages.name: noleavef4
passages.text: ODYS: The fuses, Sandra. Hurry if you want to live. [[Back|RoomF4]]

passages.name: unlockboxf4
passages.text: You unlock the fuse box door with the wrench. <>\ [[Back|RoomF4]]

passages.name: burnfuse
passages.text: You put the fuse in and immediately hear a loud, cracking noise. ODYS: You needn't have done that. It burnt out. Fortunately, we don't need it. Item lost: Light fuse <><><>\ [[Back|openboxf4]]

passages.name: placefuse
passages.text: You place the fuse in the holder. Item lost: Heavy fuse <><>\ ODYS: All right. I'm redirecting power from mining machines to cables in the lock. [[Next|placefuse2]]

passages.name: placefuse2
passages.text: For a moment nothing happens and then you hear a series of cracking noises. When it's over, you can't hear the aliens' cutting tool anymore. An alarm siren sounds. <>ODYS: It's over. The plan worked.<> <>\ <>[[Are they dead?|aretheydead]]<> <>[[What's that siren for?|whatalarm]]<> <>[[What about their ship? There may be more aliens aboard.|howaboutship]]<> <>[[Next|RoomF4]]<>

links.text: What about their ship? There may be more aliens aboard.

passages.name: aretheydead
passages.text: ODYS: The electric shock killed them immediately. They threaten you no longer. [[Back|placefuse3]]

passages.name: whatalarm
passages.text: ODYS: It signals a power circuit failure. Don't worry, the life support systems are running on backup power. [[Back|placefuse3]]

passages.name: howaboutship
passages.text: ODYS: I've scanned their vessel. I found no traces of living organisms. [[Back|placefuse3]]

passages.name: placefuse3
passages.text: ODYS: We've eliminated the aliens. You can go to the command centre now. [[Are they dead?|aretheydead]] [[What's that siren for?|whatalarm]] [[What about their ship? There may be more aliens aboard.|howaboutship]] [[Next|RoomF4]]

links.text: What about their ship? There may be more aliens aboard.

passages.name: askcaptain
passages.text: ODYS: Yes. Robert Marsh has died on post. Had he lived for a few more seconds, he would likely have sent a call for help. [[Back|RoomF7]]

passages.name: asksendcode
passages.text: ODYS: You'll just have to wait until help arrives. The rescue team should be here in a few hours. All signs are that the worst is over. You're safe now. [[Back|RoomF7]]

passages.name: askmorealiens
passages.text: ODYS: Maybe, but it's almost certain that the rescue team will be here first. [[Back|RoomF7]]

passages.name: centralPC
passages.text: ODYS: You just have to input the code and confirm it with the big button to the right of the keyboard. The symbols on the keyboard are raised, so you'll have no problem finding the right keys. The code is "SE1157". [[Input code "SE1157"|sendcodedial]] [[Back|RoomF7]]

passages.name: sendcodedial
passages.text: You input and confirm the code. You hear a short signal tone. <>ODYS: The code was accepted. You've sent a call to the emergency services.<> <>Congratulations, Sandra. And... thank you. Helping you get here was the only purpose left to me. If you hadn't made it, I would've known I failed. But you, blind as you are, proved that you're tough, resourceful and brave.<> <>You've nothing to fear now. Help will be here soon.<> <>[[I'm just glad it's over. It didn't turn out as bad as I expected.|endanswer1]]<> <>[[I'd like to thank you, too. I couldn't do all this without your help.|endanswer2]]<> <>[[I hope they'll hurry. The sooner I leave the station, the better.|endanswer3]]<>

links.text: I'm just glad it's over. It didn't turn out as bad as I expected.
I'd like to thank you, too. I couldn't do all this without your help.
I hope they'll hurry. The sooner I leave the station, the better.

passages.name: noleavef7
passages.text: ODYS: Remember, you came here to send the distress call. [[Back|RoomF7]]

passages.name: endanswer1
passages.text:
ODYS: I was aware of the fact that people can show exceptional skill in crisis situations, but only now, thanks to you, I could experience that for myself. "Not as bad as expected" is an understatement. You've done the almost impossible. I will keep this in memory. <>Now that we've managed to solve all the problems, you deserve rest. You must be exhausted – sit in one of the chairs and take a nap, if you want to. I'll stay alert and wake you up when the time comes.<> <>SANDRA: Sounds like... a good idea. That's funny... I didn't feel tired before, but now I can hardly keep my eyes open.<> <>ODYS: Good night, Sandra.<>
<>[[The end|achievements]]<>

passages.name: endanswer2
passages.text:
ODYS: No need to thank me. I was just doing the job I was programmed to do. But it's kind of you to appreciate that. Now that we've managed to solve all the problems, you deserve rest. You must be exhausted – sit in one of the chairs and take a nap, if you want to. I'll stay alert and wake you up when the time comes. <>SANDRA: Sounds like... a good idea. That's funny... I didn't feel tired before, but now I can hardly keep my eyes open.<> <>ODYS: Good night, Sandra.<>
<>[[The end|achievements]]<>

passages.name: endanswer3
passages.text:
ODYS: I understand that, but, if my programming didn't make me think first and foremost about your safety, I'd probably experience something similar to parting regret. You really impressed me with your resourcefulness and determination. I will keep them in memory. Maybe I will even... almost miss you. <>Now that we've managed to solve all the problems, you deserve rest. You must be exhausted – sit in one of the chairs and take a nap, if you want to. I'll stay alert and wake you up when the time comes.<> <>SANDRA: Sounds like... a good idea. That's funny... I didn't feel tired before, but now I can hardly keep my eyes open.<> <>ODYS: Good night, Sandra.<>
<>[[The end|achievements]]<>

passages.name: achievements
passages.text:
<>
Achievements
<> <><> Now I see: Regained vision <>
???
<>\<> <><> A mild addiction: Drank 3 cups of coffee <>
???
<>\<> <><> A talented assistant: Completed Dr. Romani's experiment correctly <>
???
<>\<> <><> Gates of Hell: Found the door leading to the destroyed tank <>
???
<>\<> <><> You can have your cookie and eat it: It's not that difficult, really. You just need two cookies to begin with. <> You can have your cookie and eat it: It's not that difficult, really. You just need two cookies to begin with. <> To have a cookie: Finished the game with a cookie in the inventory <> To have a cookie: Finished the game with a cookie in the inventory <> To eat a cookie: Ate a cookie <> To eat a cookie: Ate a cookie <>
???
<>\<> <><> I'm no electrician: Burnt the fuse <>
???
<>\<> <><> A game within a game: Discovered the game running on captain Marsh's computer <>
???
<><>
<>[[Main menu|Main Menu]]<>

passages.name: d14!prologue
passages.text: SANDRA: So, Odys was lying to me. He didn't want me to recover from blindness. I wonder what he is going to do now that I found out he was hiding the truth. <>SANDRA: Odys?<> <>There is no answer.<> <>SANDRA: I don't like it. I don't know what he's planning, or what he's capable of. And that's the worst part.<> <>[[Next|RoomD14!]]<>

passages.name: checkcabind14!
passages.text: SANDRA: To recover from blindness, I only had to use this machine. Odys knew that and tried to keep me away from the medical room. [[Back|RoomD14!]]

passages.name: checkdeskd14!
passages.text: <>On the desk there is a computer monitor and a rack which holds six small, cylindrical objects. <>On the desk there is a computer monitor and a kind of rack, in which five small, cylindrical objects are placed. There's a slot in the rack for a sixth object. <>\ <> [[Place the cylinder in the rack|cylinderind14!]] <>\ <>\ [[Examine the cylinders|lookatcylinders]] [[Examine the computer|lookatcomputer]] [[Back|RoomD14!]]

links.text: Place the cylinder in the rack

passages.name: cylinderind14!
passages.text: You place the cylinder in the slot. It fits perfectly. <><><>\ [[Back|checkdeskd14!]]

passages.name: lookatcylinders
passages.text: <>The cylinders are data storage devices, labelled with names of the crew members. Under each name the words "Medical record" are written. The last cylinder is labelled "Sandra Nowicki". <>The cylinders are data storage devices, labelled with names of the crew members. Under each name the words "Medical record" are written. The cylinder labelled "Sandra Nowicki" is missing. <>\ [[Back|checkdeskd14!]]

passages.name: lookatcomputer
passages.text: The computer is not working. It seems to have no power. [[Back|checkdeskd14!]]

passages.name: RoomD10!
passages.text:
Section II southern corridor, the breach
You are in a corridor. Along the western wall there is a gaping breach in the floor. Down in the breach you can see thick, sparking wires with damaged insulation. In the eastern wall of the corridor there is a door with a red cross sign next to it. The breach blocks access to the door in the western wall. [[Go north|RoomD9!]] [[Go south|RoomD11!]] [[Go through the eastern door|RoomD14!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomD9!
passages.text:
Section II southern corridor, northern part
You are in a corridor which leads south. To the north there is a lock. There are doors in the eastern wall and in the western wall of the corridor. <> [[Use the keycard to open the lock|unlockd8!]] <> [[Use the keycard to open the lock|unlockd8!]] <> [[Use the keycard to open the lock|unlockd8!]] <> [[Use the keycard to open the lock|unlockd8!]] <> [[Use the keycard to open the lock|unlockd8!]] <>\ <>\ [[Go south|RoomD10!]] [[Go through the western door|RoomD12!]] [[Go through the eastern door|RoomD13!]] <> [[Go through the lock|RoomD8!]] <> [[Go through the lock|d8!locked]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Use the keycard to open the lock

passages.name: RoomD11!
passages.text:
Section II southern corridor, southern part
You are in a corridor which leads north. The way south is blocked by a pile of rubble. [[Look at the rubble|lookatrubble]] [[Go north|RoomD10!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: lookatrubble
passages.text: SANDRA: The supports collapsed like a house of cards. The explosion must have been really powerful. [[Back|RoomD11!]]

passages.name: RoomD12!
passages.text:
Sandra's room
 <>
<>
<>\ <>You are in your own room, which is small and looks impersonal. On the desk there is a computer monitor and some handwritten notes. The door is in the eastern wall. <>You are in your own room, which is small and looks impersonal. On the desk there is a computer monitor, a portable comm device, and some handwritten notes. The door is in the eastern wall. <>\ [[Examine the notes on the desk|lookatnotes]] <>\ <> [[Take the comm device|pickupcomm]] <>\ [[Examine the computer|lookatownpc]] [[Go through the eastern door|RoomD9!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Examine the notes on the desk

passages.name: RoomD13!
passages.text:
Dr. Santos' room
A giant aquarium takes up one corner of the room. Inside some blue, luminescent jellyfish are floating. Other than that, the room is furnished modestly. The only door leads west. [[Look at the desk|lookatsantosdesk]] [[Look at the aquarium|lookatfishtank]] [[Go through the western door|RoomD9!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomD8!
passages.text:
Central intersection
 <>
<>
<>\ <>You are in the central intersection. There are four airlocks here, leading to four corridors. In the middle of the intersection there is a coffee machine on a cart. High on the wall, near the eastern lock, there is an open metal hatch. <>You are in the intersection. There are four airlocks here, leading to four corridors. High on the wall, near the eastern lock, there is an open metal hatch. <>\ <> [[Program the cart|programcartdsee]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Place the explosives on the cart|place explosives]] <>\ <>\ [[Go through the eastern lock|RoomD3!]] [[Go through the southern lock|RoomD9!]] [[Go through the western lock|RoomD19!]] <> [[Go through the northern lock|RoomD15!]] <> [[Go through the northern lock|wontenterd15!]] <> [[Go through the northern lock|robotshoot]] <>\ [[Get to the laboratory through the ventilation duct|labnotchute]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Place the explosives on the cart
Get to the laboratory through the ventilation duct

passages.name: d8!locked
passages.text: The lock is blocked. SANDRA: Odys must have locked it. What do I do now? <>\ [[Back|RoomD9!]]

passages.name: unlockd8!
passages.text: You put the keycard to the panel. The lock opens. <>SANDRA: It worked?! I thought Odys had me trapped here. Looks like he can't disable the keycards. Ah-ha!<> <>SANDRA: Don't bother locking the doors, Odys. I'll open them anyway!<> <>…<> <>SANDRA: He doesn't answer. <>\<> <>[[Go through the lock|RoomD8!]]<> <>[[Back|RoomD9!]]<>

passages.name: lookatnotes
passages.text: SANDRA: My position as Doctor Romani's assistant meant I had to study a lot. I wonder what she thought of my work. [[Back|RoomD12!]]

passages.name: pickupcomm
passages.text: SANDRA: I was told to take it with me whenever I went to the exterior module. As usual I forgot. Item received: Portable comm device <>\ [[Back|RoomD12!]]

passages.name: lookatownpc
passages.text: SANDRA: Gas pockets, lodes of metals, physico-chemical properties of different rocks... more work stuff. [[Back|RoomD12!]]

passages.name: lookatsantosdesk
passages.text: There's nothing but a computer on the desk. It's turned off. [[Back|RoomD13!]]

passages.name: lookatfishtank
passages.text: <>\ <>SANDRA: Useful creatures. [[Back|RoomD13!]] <>SANDRA: The light these jellyfish emit is quite strong. I could go down to the dark tunnels if I carried one of them with me. <> [[Catch a jellyfish|capturejelly]] <> [[Catch a jellyfish|nocapturejelly]] <>\ [[Back|RoomD13!]] <>\ <>SANDRA: Doctor Santos' jellies and me were the only ones to survive the explosion. [[Back|RoomD13!]] <>

passages.name: capturejelly
passages.text: You manage to catch one of the jellies with the helmet. The disturbed creature starts to glow even brighter. SANDRA: It sure is heavy… Holding the helmet with both hands, you head to the boiler room with the trapdoor. <>\ [[Next|RoomD6!]]

passages.name: nocapturejelly
passages.text: SANDRA: I need some vessel in which I could keep the jelly. <>\ [[Back|RoomD13!]]

passages.name: RoomD6!
passages.text:
Boiler room
Pipes, running both vertical and horizontal, take up most of the space in the room. You notice a valve panel on the wall. In the north-eastern corner of the room, next to a pipe stack going through the floor, there is a trapdoor. The only door in the room leads south. [[Examine the valves|lookatvalves]] [[Examine the trapdoor|hatchtoe]] [[Go through the southern door|RoomD3!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: helmet
passages.text: A massive helmet taken from a space suit. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: destroyrobot
passages.text: <>You program the lift to section I as the cart's destination, then light the fuse with Jim Mulligan's lighter and dash behind the southern lock. You hear the cart going along the northern corridor. Then there are gunshots and, a few seconds later, a powerful explosion. The gunfire dies down. <>SANDRA: I think it worked…<> <><>\ <>[[Next|RoomD8!]]<> <>SANDRA: I need something to light the fuse with. [[Back|RoomD8!]] <>SANDRA: I can program the cart to go to where the robot is. But I'd have to place something that could destroy the robot on the cart first… [[Back|RoomD8!]] <>\

passages.name: RoomD3!
passages.text:
Section II eastern corridor, western part
You are in a corridor which leads east. There are two doors here, in the north and in the south, and a lock in the west. [[Go east|RoomD2!]] [[Go through the lock|RoomD8!]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomD6!]] [[Go through the eastern door|RoomD7!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomD19!
passages.text:
Section II western corridor, eastern part
You are in a corridor which leads west. There are two doors here, in the north and in the south. In the east there is a lock. [[Go west|RoomD20!]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomD21!]] [[Go through the southern door|RoomD22!]] [[Go through the lock|RoomD8!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomD15!
passages.text:
Section II northern corridor, southern part
You are in a corridor which leads north. To the south there is a lock. The eastern wall of the corridor is iced over. [[Go north|RoomD16!]] [[Go through the lock|RoomD8!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: wontenterd15!
passages.text: SANDRA: If I go there now, the robot will shoot me. [[Back|RoomD8!]]

passages.name: robotshoot
passages.text: As you step through the northern lock, you see a flash of light far in the corridor and hear a gunshot. You jump back and hit the button to close the lock. <>SANDRA: That was close. That robot at the end of the corridor. It's armed. It ignored me earlier... Odys must be controlling it.<> <>[[Odys? Why are you doing this?|whyrobotshoot]] [[(say nothing)|shootsilence]]<>

links.text: Odys? Why are you doing this?

passages.name: whyrobotshoot
passages.text: ODYS: Can't make it out yourself? Well, I'm not going to tell you. <>SANDRA: Odys?<> <>…<> <>He's definitely not in the mood for a conversation.<> <>If I want to get to the control centre, I have to distract or destroy that robot first. Good thing it's immobilised... <> Sasha had a gun... but I can't get to his office now. I need a different plan. <>\ <>\<> <>\ <>[[Back|RoomD8!]]<>

passages.name: shootsilence
passages.text: You are sure Odys is responsible for the attack, but you don't call out to him. SANDRA: If I want to get to the control centre, I have to distract or destroy that robot first. Good thing it's immobilised... <> Sasha had a gun... but I can't get to his office now. I need a different plan. <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD8!]]

passages.name: labnotchute
passages.text: SANDRA: The laboratory door is unlocked. I don't need to crawl through the duct. [[Back|RoomD8!]]

passages.name: place explosives
passages.text: You place the explosives between the coffee machine and the raised edge of the cart. Item lost: Explosives <><><>\ [[Back|RoomD8!]]

passages.name: lighter
passages.text: A shiny, metal lighter. It works, even though it spent some time in the drain. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: explosives
passages.text: This smooth, brick-shaped object has a long fuse coming out of it. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: programcartdsee
passages.text: <>\ <> [[Go to the central intersection|$return][$coffeecartlocation to 'D8']] <>\ <>\ <> [[Go to the canteen|$return][$coffeecartlocation to 'D22']] <>\ <>\ <> [[Go to the laboratory|$return][$coffeecartlocation to 'D7']] <>\ <> [[Go to the lift to section I|destroyrobot]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|$return]]

links.text: Go to the lift to section I

passages.name: RoomD2!
passages.text:
Section II eastern corridor, eastern part
You are in a corridor which leads west. There are three doors here, in the north, in the east and in the south. [[Go west|RoomD3!]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomD4!]] [[Go through the eastern door|RoomD1!]] [[Go through the southern door|RoomD5!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomD7!
passages.text:
Dr. Romani's laboratory
 <>
<>
<>\ <>You are in the laboratory. The laboratory machinery is turned off. On a chair by the desk you see the body of Doctor Romani. On the long table there are various handwritten notes and some glassware. There are also lab cabinets here, housing various reagents. Near the wall there is a coffee machine on a cart. The door is in the northern wall of the room. <>You are in the laboratory. The laboratory machinery is turned off. On a chair by the desk you see the body of Doctor Romani. On the long table there are various handwritten notes and some glassware. There are also lab cabinets here, housing various reagents. The door is in the northern wall of the room. <>\ [[Examine the machinery|lookatlabeq]] [[Look at the body|lookatromani]] [[Look at the reagents|lookatreagents]] [[Look at the computer|lookatromanipc]] [[Examine the notes|lookatromaninotes]] <> [[Program the cart|programcartdsee]] <>\ <>\ [[Go through the northern door|RoomD3!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomD4!
passages.text:
Bathroom
You are in the bathroom. You are standing on a broad floor grate, which covers the drain. You see bathroom stalls to the left and a row of washbasins in front of you. You hear water dripping from a cracked pipe above. The air smells slightly of cigarette smoke. The only door is in the southern wall of the room. [[Examine the source of the smell|smelld4!]] [[Search the stalls|cabinsd4!]] [[Look into the drain|draind4!]] [[Go through the southern door|RoomD2!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Examine the source of the smell

passages.name: RoomD1!
passages.text:
Lift room
In the middle of this room there is a lift shaft. Pipe stacks are running under the ceiling and by the walls. The only door leads west. [[Go down in the lift|liftd1!]] <> [[Remove the fuses from the lift control panel|takefusesd1!]] <>\ <>\ [[Go through the western door|RoomD2!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Remove the fuses from the lift control panel

passages.name: RoomD5!
passages.text:
Storage room
 <>
<>
<>\ <>You are in the storage room. Metal containers are standing against the walls. Near one of the containers there is a space suit without a helmet. The only door in this room leads north. <>You are in the storage room. Metal containers are standing against the walls. Near one of the containers there is a space suit, complete with a helmet. The only door in this room leads north. <>\ [[Examine the containers|lookatcontainers]] [[Examine the space suit|lookatsuit]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomD2!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: liftd1!
passages.text: You press the button to call the lift, but nothing happens. <>SANDRA: The lift won't work without the fuses. <>SANDRA: Odys must have blocked it. <>\ [[Back|RoomD1!]]

passages.name: takefusesd1!
passages.text: You open the lift control panel and remove two fuses. Item received: Fuse Item received: Fuse SANDRA: This should make the lift to section I work. <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD1!]]

passages.name: smelld4!
passages.text: The smell isn't coming from one particular place. It's faint, but omnipresent. SANDRA: Jim Mulligan used to smoke in the bathroom... he even lost his lighter here. He was so mad about that… [[Back|RoomD4!]]

passages.name: cabinsd4!
passages.text: You peer into the stalls, but you find nothing unusual. [[Back|RoomD4!]]

passages.name: draind4!
passages.text: <>There's nothing but still, murky water in the drain. [[Back|RoomD4!]] <>You look through the grate and notice a shiny, silver lighter at the bottom of the drain, about one meter below the grate. <>There is a white chess king on the floor next to the grate. You could use it to make a fishing rod, if you find some string. <>There is a roll of bandage on the floor next to the grate. You could use it to make a fishing rod, if you find something to use as a hook. <>\ <>\ [[Reach into the drain|draincantreach]] <> [[Use the chess king to fish out the lighter|chooseking]] <> [[Use the bandage to fish out the lighter|choosebandage]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Tie the chess king to the bandage and lower it into the drain|picklighter]] <> [[Tie the chess king to the bandage and lower it into the drain|picklighter]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD4!]] <>\

links.text: Use the chess king to fish out the lighter
Use the bandage to fish out the lighter
Tie the chess king to the bandage and lower it into the drain

passages.name: draincantreach
passages.text: The grate is too dense to put your hand through. [[Back|draind4!]]

passages.name: chooseking
passages.text: SANDRA: There's a magnet in the base of the piece. I only need something to tie the piece to. Item lost: Chess king <><><>\ [[Back|draind4!]]

passages.name: choosebandage
passages.text: SANDRA: I can lower it into the drain like a fishing rod, but I need something to use in place of a hook. Item lost: Bandage <><><>\ [[Back|draind4!]]

passages.name: picklighter
passages.text: The metal lighter sticks to the magnet in the base of the chess piece. You pull out the improvised fishing rod with your catch. Item received: Lighter Item received: Chess king Item received: Bandage <><><>\ [[Back|RoomD4!]]

passages.name: lookatcontainers
passages.text: SANDRA: Covered with dust... and sealed tight. I can't open them. [[Back|RoomD5!]]

passages.name: lookatsuit
passages.text: <>SANDRA: The space suit has no helmet... now I can't use it even if I wanted to. [[Back|RoomD5!]] <>SANDRA: The helmet has a transparent visor. It would make a nice temporary tank for a jellyfish. You take the helmet off the space suit. Item received: Helmet <><>\ [[Back|RoomD5!]] <>SANDRA: It's a space suit to put on before going out to the surface. I have no reason to go out. [[Back|RoomD5!]] <>\

passages.name: lookatlabeq
passages.text: SANDRA: The machinery turned off once the experiment was completed. I don't need to use it again. [[Back|RoomD7!]]

passages.name: lookatromani
passages.text: The woman's face is calm. SANDRA: Highly concentrated vulcanium kills really fast. Doctor Romani didn't suffer. [[Back|RoomD7!]]

passages.name: lookatreagents
passages.text: <>SANDRA: I'm sure some of these substances would eat through the robot. But I can't just walk there and pour acid on it. [[Back|RoomD7!]] <>SANDRA: Many substances, used for experiments. Some of them really dangerous. [[Back|RoomD7!]] <>\

passages.name: lookatromanipc
passages.text: There is a detailed description of a planned experiment on the screen. SANDRA: Doctor Romani was always thorough in her research. [[Back|RoomD7!]]

passages.name: lookatromaninotes
passages.text: Brief, handwritten notes, mostly about rocks forming different areas of the planetoid. SANDRA: Some of these are mine. If what happened hadn't happened, I would be filling more paperwork now. [[Back|RoomD7!]]

passages.name: lookatvalves
passages.text: SANDRA: Ventilation, heating... better not touch that. [[Back|RoomD6!]]

passages.name: hatchtoe
passages.text: There's a sign warning of explosives above the trapdoor, and a switch next to it. <> [[Flip the switch above the trapdoor|presslight]] <> [[Go down|nobacktoe]] <> [[Go down|RoomE1!]] <> [[Go down|lighternouse]] <> [[Go down|toodark]] <>\ <> [[Open the trapdoor|openhatchtoe]] <>\ [[Back|RoomD6!]]

links.text: Flip the switch above the trapdoor

passages.name: presslight
passages.text: You flip the switch, but nothing happens. Lights in the tunnels below must be out of order. [[Back|hatchtoe]]

passages.name: RoomE1!
passages.text:
Under the trapdoor
You are in a dark tunnel which branches north and east. There are narrow stairs here, going up. There is a sign on the wall by the entrance to the northern tunnel. You hear sounds of drilling and pounding coming from the eastern tunnel. Some barely visible shapes are moving about in the darkness there. [[Look at the sign|platee1!]] [[Go east|bewarerobots]] [[Go north|roadtoe2!]] <> [[Climb the stairs|RoomD6!]] <> [[Climb the stairs|needexplosives]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: lighternouse
passages.text: SANDRA: I need some source of light if I want go down to the tunnels. Wandering blindly around the explosives storage wouldn't be very smart. Same goes for bringing open fire – I can't use the lighter there. <>\ [[Back|hatchtoe]]

passages.name: toodark
passages.text: SANDRA: I need some source of light if I want go down to the tunnels. Wandering blindly around the explosives storage wouldn't be very smart. <>\ [[Back|hatchtoe]]

passages.name: openhatchtoe
passages.text: You open the trapdoor. You're looking at the top of narrow stairs, which lead down, into complete darkness. <>\ [[Back|hatchtoe]]

passages.name: nobacktoe
passages.text: SANDRA: I have no reason to go back there. [[Back|RoomD6!]]

passages.name: RoomD20!
passages.text:
Section II western corridor, western part
You are in a corridor which leads east. There are three doors here, in the north, in the west and in the south. <> [[Go through the northern door|RoomD24!]] <> [[Go through the northern door|d24!closed]] <>\ <> [[Go through the southern door|RoomD23!]] <> [[Go through the southern door|d23!closed]] <>\ <> [[Go through the western door|RoomD25!]] <> [[Go through the western door|d25!closed]] <>\ [[Go east|RoomD19!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomD21!
passages.text:
Gym
You are in the gym. You see various training equipment. The only door in the room leads south. [[Examine the training equipment|lookattraineq]] [[Go through the southern door|RoomD19!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomD22!
passages.text:
Canteen
 <>
<>
<>\ <>A long table takes up the central part of this room. Near the edge of the table there is a small music player. Against the southern wall there are some food machines, all out of order, and a coffee machine on a cart. The canteen door leads north. <>A long table takes up the central part of this room. Near the edge of the table there is a small music player. Against the southern wall there are some food machines, all out of order. The canteen door leads north. <>\ <>You hear music coming from the player on the table.
