A tiny robot is dancing madly on the floor. <>\ <>\ [[Examine the machines against the wall|lookatfoodmachines]] [[Look at the table|lookatfoodtable]] <> [[Program the cart|programcartdsee]] <>\ <>\ [[Examine the music player|lookatradio]] <> [[Look at the dancing robot|lookatdancingrobot]] <>\ <>\ [[Go through the northern door|RoomD19!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Examine the machines against the wall

passages.name: RoomD24!
passages.text:
Sasha Zinov's room
You are in Sasha's Zinov room. It's clean and tidy. Only on the bed there is an open book, spine up. There is a bookshelf on the wall. On the desk there is a computer monitor. The only door leads south. [[Look at the bookshelf|lookatsashabooks]] [[Look at the book on the bed|lookbookonbed]] [[Look at the computer monitor|lookatsasharoompc]] [[Go through the southern door|RoomD20!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Look at the book on the bed

passages.name: d24!closed
passages.text: The door is locked. SANDRA: This is the door to Sasha Zinov's room. <> [[Use Sasha's keycard to unlock the door|unlockd24!]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD20!]]

links.text: Use Sasha's keycard to unlock the door

passages.name: unlockd24!
passages.text: You put Sasha's keycard to the panel. The door opens. <>\ [[Go through the door|RoomD24!]] [[Back|RoomD20!]]

passages.name: RoomD23!
passages.text:
Jim Mulligan's room
You are in a small room. There is a bed, a bookshelf and a computer desk here. A portable communication device is lying on the desk. The only door leads north. [[Look at the bookshelf|lookatmulliganbooks]] [[Examine the computer|lookatpcmulliganroom]] [[Examine the comm device|lookatmulcomm]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomD20!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: d23!closed
passages.text: The door is locked. SANDRA: This is the door to Mulligan's room. <> [[Use Mulligan's keycard to unlock the door|unlockd23!]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD20!]]

links.text: Use Mulligan's keycard to unlock the door

passages.name: unlockd23!
passages.text: You put Mulligan's keycard to the panel. The door opens. <>\ [[Go through the door|RoomD23!]] [[Back|RoomD20!]]

passages.name: RoomD25!
passages.text:
Robert Marsh's room
You are in a large room. To the right from the door there is a bed, a wardrobe and a table. To the left from the door there is a computer desk. The computer on the desk is switched on and emits disturbing sounds of explosions and torn metal. The only door is in the eastern wall of the room. [[Examine the wardrobe and the table|marshstuff]] [[Look at the computer|gamerpc]] [[Go through the eastern door|RoomD20!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Examine the wardrobe and the table

passages.name: d25!closed
passages.text: The door is locked. SANDRA: This is the door to captain Marsh's room. There is no way to open it. [[Back|RoomD20!]]

passages.name: lookattraineq
passages.text: SANDRA: They told us to exercise on a daily basis. You need that to stay fit when you live on a planetoid... [[Back|RoomD21!]]

passages.name: lookatfoodmachines
passages.text: SANDRA: Nothing's working here... [[Examine the food dispenser|lookatcookingmach]] [[Examine the tableware dispenser|lookatdishmach]] [[Examine the machine for returning used tableware|lookatwashingmach]] [[Back|RoomD22!]]

links.text: Examine the machine for returning used tableware

passages.name: lookatcookingmach
passages.text: Whichever button you press, nothing happens. [[Back|lookatfoodmachines]]

passages.name: lookatdishmach
passages.text: <>The dispenser is out of order. [[Back|lookatfoodmachines]] <>The dispenser is out of order. There is a teaspoon on its tray. [[Pick up the teaspoon|takespoon!]] [[Back|lookatfoodmachines]] <>\

passages.name: lookatwashingmach
passages.text: The machine has no power. [[Back|lookatfoodmachines]]

passages.name: takespoon!
passages.text: Item received: Teaspoon <>\ [[Back|lookatfoodmachines]]

passages.name: lookatfoodtable
passages.text: There are remains of a meal on the table – some mashed potatoes and a sausage. [[Back|RoomD22!]]

passages.name: lookatradio
passages.text: <>The music player is on. [[Turn off the player|musicoff!]] [[Back|RoomD22!]] <>The music player is off. [[Turn on the player|musicon!]] [[Back|RoomD22!]] <>

passages.name: musicoff!
passages.text: You turn off the player. The music stops. You hear a scratching noise and see the little robot running to its hiding place. <>\ [[Back|lookatradio]]

passages.name: musicon!
passages.text: You turn on the device. It starts playing an energising tune. <>\ <>The funny little robot emerges from behind the machines again and starts wiggling to the music. [[Back|lookatradio]] <> Suddenly you hear a quiet scratching noise. A tiny service robot comes from behind one of the canteen machines and marches in the direction of the music player. It stops by the table and starts wiggling to the music. It's holding a foil-wrapped cake in its manipulator. [[Take the cookie|takecookie2!]] [[Eat the cookie|eatcookie2!]] [[Back|lookatradio]] <>

passages.name: takecookie2!
passages.text: You bend down and take the foil-wrapped cookie from the robot's manipulator. The little robot takes no notice – he continues jumping to the rhythm. Item received: Cookie <><>\ [[Back|lookatradio]]

passages.name: eatcookie2!
passages.text: SANDRA: It's foil-wrapped, so I guess it's safe... You open the package and eat the cookie. SANDRA: Chocolate – my favourite. <><>\ [[Back|lookatradio]]

passages.name: lookatdancingrobot
passages.text: The little robot is jiggling to the music.<><> It's holding a cookie in its manipulator.<> <>\ <> [[Take the cookie|takecookie22!]] [[Eat the cookie|eatcookie22!]] <>\ [[Back|RoomD22!]]

passages.name: takecookie22!
passages.text: You bend down and take the foil-wrapped cookie from the robot's manipulator. The little robot takes no notice – he continues jumping to the rhythm. Item received: Cookie <><>\ [[Back|RoomD22!]]

passages.name: eatcookie22!
passages.text: SANDRA: It's foil-wrapped, so I guess it's safe... You open the package and eat the cookie. SANDRA: Chocolate – my favourite. <><>\ [[Back|RoomD22!]]

passages.name: lookatmulliganbooks
passages.text: Books on mining machines, mining regulations and similar topics are lined on the shelf. They are covered with a thick layer of dust. You see a gap between two tomes, meaning one book is missing. [[Back|RoomD23!]]

passages.name: lookatpcmulliganroom
passages.text: The computer is turned on and "J. Mulligan" is logged in as the user. You see two folders on the desktop. [[Open the "Checks and controls" folder|opencontrfolder]] [[Open the "Cars" folder|opencars]] [[Back|RoomD23!]]

passages.name: lookatmulcomm
passages.text: The device is not working – there is no battery inside. [[Back|RoomD23!]]

passages.name: opencontrfolder
passages.text: The folder contains filled technical inspection forms. The data differs a bit between the forms, but each set shows that facility machinery fulfils all requirements. There are future dates on some of the forms. SANDRA: Mulligan... lied about inspection results? And prepared false reports in advance? Unbelievable... he seemed reliable, but he put us all in such danger! He'd been bribed, I'm sure. Irresponsible asshole... <>\ [[Back|lookatpcmulliganroom]]

passages.name: opencars
passages.text: You see various information on sports cars – photos, videos and car dealers' offers. [[Back|lookatpcmulliganroom]]

passages.name: lookatsashabooks
passages.text: You see specialised literature, but also some novels – mostly sci-fi and historical fiction. [[Back|RoomD24!]]

passages.name: lookbookonbed
passages.text: This thick volume is titled "Mining machinery maintenance – regulations and recommendations". [[Back|RoomD24!]]

passages.name: lookatsasharoompc
passages.text: The computer is turned off. [[Back|RoomD24!]]

passages.name: marshstuff
passages.text: You see captain Marsh's clothes scattered around. [[Back|RoomD25!]]

passages.name: gamerpc
passages.text: You come closer to the computer. A looped sequence is playing on the screen. It shows a view from the cockpit of a starfighter flying through some tunnel. The ship's guns flash with fire. Enemy fighters explode in the background. At the bottom of the screen you see a flashing text: PRESS ANY BUTTON TO START THE GAME. <>\ [[Play the game|cantplaynow]] [[Back|RoomD25!]]

passages.name: cantplaynow
passages.text: SANDRA: I have no time for that. Besides, I'm awful at arcade games. [[Back|RoomD25!]]

passages.name: RoomD16!
passages.text:
Section II northern corridor, northern part
You are in a corridor which leads south. There is a damaged lift door to the north. Parts of a humanoid robot are scattered on the floor nearby. There are doors in the western and in the eastern wall of the corridor, and a hatch in the ceiling. You see traces of blood, leading to the western door. [[Examine the remains of the robot|lookatbadrobot]] [[Look at the traces of blood|lookatblood]] [[Look at the hatch|hatchd16!]] [[Go through the western door|RoomD17!]] [[Go south|RoomD15!]] <> [[Take lift to section I|threats]] <> [[Take lift to section I|lifttofbroken!]] <>\ <> [[Install the fuse in the lift control box|mountfused1!]] <> [[Install the fuse in the lift control box|mountfused2!]] <>\ <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Examine the remains of the robot
Look at the traces of blood
Install the fuse in the lift control box
Install the fuse in the lift control box

passages.name: lookatbadrobot
passages.text: SANDRA: Not much left of it. I'm lucky the ceiling didn't collapse in the explosion. [[Back|RoomD16!]]

passages.name: lookatblood
passages.text: The bloody line starts in the middle of the corridor and leads to Sasha's office door. [[Back|RoomD16!]]

passages.name: hatchd16!
passages.text: There is no ladder under the hatch. You see no way of getting up there. [[Back|RoomD16!]]

passages.name: RoomD17!
passages.text:
Sasha Zinov's office
A huge desk takes up the centre of Zinov's office. Next to the desk, on the floor by a chair, you see the body of the IT specialist. Traces of blood lead to the corpse. You notice some item under the desk. Against the eastern wall of the room there is a sideboard with one large drawer. The only door in the room leads east. [[Examine the body|lookatsasha]] [[Look at the desk|longdesk]] [[Examine the sideboard|chesspuzzle]] [[Go through the eastern door|RoomD16!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: threats
passages.text: <>You call the lift to the upper level. [[Next|RoomF1!]] <>ODYS: Bad idea. I have total control over section I systems. Turn back, or I'll have to kill you. <>\ [[(say nothing)|threatsilence]] [[I think you're lying, just like before. You're just trying to scare me. I won't listen to you.|youlie]] <> [[Sasha almost shut you down. I think that, actually, your options are very limited.|youlie]] <>\ <>\ <>\

links.text: I think you're lying, just like before. You're just trying to scare me. I won't listen to you.
Sasha almost shut you down. I think that, actually, your options are very limited.

passages.name: lifttofbroken!
passages.text: <>You press the button, but the lift does not come. SANDRA: I have to install the fuses first. [[Back|RoomD16!]] <>You press the button, but the lift does not come. It seems to have no power. You open the fuse box by the lift. There are two fuses inside – both burnt out. SANDRA: Dammit. I have to find some replacements. Let me think... there should be matching fuses by the lift which goes down to the mine tunnels. <>\ [[Back|RoomD16!]] <>\

passages.name: mountfused1!
passages.text: <>You open the box and install the first fuse. Item lost: Fuse <><><>\ [[Back|RoomD16!]] <>You open the box and install the second fuse. The lift control panel lights up. Item lost: Fuse <><><><>\ [[Back|RoomD16!]] <>\ <>\

passages.name: mountfused2!
passages.text: <>You open the box and install the first fuse. Item lost: Fuse <><><>\ [[Back|RoomD16!]] <>You open the box and install the second fuse. The lift control panel lights up. Item lost: Fuse <><><><>\ [[Back|RoomD16!]] <>\ <>\

passages.name: threatsilence
passages.text: Ignoring Odys' threats, you get into the lift. [[Next|RoomF1!]]

passages.name: youlie
passages.text: Having received no answer, you get into the lift. [[Next|RoomF1!]]

passages.name: RoomF1!
passages.text:
Corridor by the lift
 <>
<>
<>\ <>\ <> As you go up in the lift, you hear a tone signalling that a ship has docked to the section I module. <>\ <>\ You are in a corridor which leads north. To the south there is a lift door. You see pipes by the western wall, coming through the floor, then turning and running horizontally under the ceiling. [[Look at the pipes|pipesf1!]] [[Go down to section II in the lift|RoomD16!]] <> [[Go north|RoomF2!]] <> [[Go north|roadtof2!]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Go down to section II in the lift

passages.name: lookatsasha
passages.text: <>Sasha is lying on the floor.<>Sasha is lying face to the floor. You cautiously turn the body over and immediately notice two gunshot wounds. Sasha's shirt is soaked with blood.<><> SANDRA: That robot shot him... Sasha managed to immobilise it and ran to his office, but died of his wounds soon after. [[Search the body|searchpistol]] [[Back|RoomD17!]]

passages.name: searchpistol
passages.text: <>SANDRA: Poor Sasha. I'll leave him alone. [[Back|RoomD17!]] <>You find a pistol by Sasha's body. Item received: Pistol <>\ [[Back|RoomD17!]] <>You find a pistol and Sasha's keycard by the body. Item received: Sasha's keycard Item received: Pistol <><><>\ [[Back|RoomD17!]] <>\

passages.name: pistol
passages.text: Found by Sasha's body. Seems to be captain Marsh's service weapon, which he never carried. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: longdesk
passages.text: You see an open notebook and a photo frame on the desk. You also notice some object lying on the floor under the desk. [[Examine the notebook|lookatcode]] [[Look at the photo|lookatphoto]] [[Look at the object under the desk|sashasmask]] [[Examine Sasha's computer|longpc]] [[Back|RoomD17!]]

links.text: Look at the object under the desk

passages.name: lookatcode
passages.text: The open pages of the notebook are covered in hastily drawn functions and diagrams. There's a note on the margin: "Code – F4". <>\ [[Back|longdesk]]

passages.name: lookatphoto
passages.text: In the photo you see Sasha with a young woman. Both are smiling. There are trees in the background. [[Back|longdesk]]

passages.name: sashasmask
passages.text: There is a breath mask on the floor, just like the one you're wearing. The head straps are torn, which suggests the wearer was taking the mask off in a hurry, tugging violently. [[Back|longdesk]]

passages.name: longpc
passages.text: On the screen you see an open text file and a "Recent system operations" icon. [[Read the text file|exposition]] [[Click the "Recent system operations" icon|moreexposition]] <> [[Press the F4 button on the keyboard|pressf4]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|longdesk]]

links.text: Press the F4 button on the keyboard

passages.name: exposition
passages.text: "I hope this message gets through to the emergency services. My name's Sasha Zinov and I'm the IT specialist in OSMiC planetoid mine BT-81. We had a major accident in the facility. One of the vulcanium tanks exploded. OSMiC was cutting corners on operation safety. The tank didn't meet the norms, just like a lot of other equipment. I suspect they bribed Mulligan, our chief technician, to sign false inspection reports." "I don't know if anyone but me survived the explosion. I grabbed a breath mask in time, so that gas didn't kill me. But I was attacked by a service robot which shot me twice. I had a gun. I managed to immobilise the robot. I ran off to my office." "Not long ago I accidentally discovered that the facility's assistant AI has a surprising range of so-called "emergency rights", quite ineptly masked. This got me suspicious. I've studied the matter in secret for the last few weeks. These "emergency rights" activated after the accident. Before I wrote this, I had blocked the AI's access to all key systems. Right now the AI is trying to bypass my blockades. This program was designed by OSMiC to cover the traces in case of an accident, by destroying all evidence. This program controlled the robot that shot me. OSMiC would rather see the station destroyed completely, so that no one can determine the cause of the explosion, than allow the public to learn about their misconduct, which would cost them millions in damages." "I've no strength left. I hope someone reads this. I hope OSMiC pays. The pain is unbearable. I'm going to take off the mask. The gas is at least going to end this quickly." <>\ [[Back|longpc]]

passages.name: moreexposition
passages.text: Clicking the icon opens a long list of system changes. Several points immediately catch your attention: 15:34:03 AI emergency rights activated by: auto 15:34:10 Ventilation hatch to the exterior module opened by: Odys 15:34:40 Ventilation hatch to the exterior module closed by: Odys 15:37:13 NoYouDont program launched by: Zinov 15:37:22 Attempt to access SE program folder by: Odys. Access denied by: NoYouDont 15:37:28 Outgoing message to: Command centre, from: Zinov 15:37:58 Distress call sent by: Zinov 15:38:00 Attempt to access SE program folder by: Odys. Access denied by: NoYouDont … 17:55:36 System restarted by: external reset 17:55:36 Re-launching NoYouDont program partially unsuccessful 17:55:37 Attempt to access SE program folder by: Odys. Access denied by: NoYouDont <>\ [[Back|longpc]]

passages.name: pressf4
passages.text: You press the key, but nothing happens. [[Back|longpc]]

passages.name: chesspuzzle
passages.text: <>A chessboard is set on the sideboard. There is only one piece on the board, the white king. <>A chessboard is set on the sideboard, but there are no pieces on it. <>\ [[Open the drawer|opendrawer!]] [[Examine the chessboard|chessboard]] <> [[Place the king on the chessboard|placeking]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Pick up the white king|pickupking]] <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomD17!]]

links.text: Place the king on the chessboard

passages.name: opendrawer!
passages.text: <>The drawer is locked, but you see no keyhole. [[Back|chesspuzzle]] <> You open the drawer. There is only a handwritten note inside, stating: "Great, it works. Now here's your reward". [[Back|chesspuzzle]] <> You pull the handle and open the drawer easily. Inside there is a foil-wrapped cookie and a handwritten note, stating: "Great, it works. Now here's your reward". [[Take the cookie|takecookie!]] [[Eat the cookie|eatcookie!]] [[Back|chesspuzzle]] <>The drawer is locked, but you see no keyhole. [[Back|chesspuzzle]] <>\

passages.name: takecookie!
passages.text: SANDRA: Whatever this prize is for, I'm going to accept it. Item received: Cookie <><>\ [[Back|chesspuzzle]]

passages.name: eatcookie!
passages.text: SANDRA: Sasha... has no use for it anymore, and I've just realised I'm really hungry. You open the package and eat the cookie. SANDRA: I think I've made the best possible use of it. <><>\ [[Back|chesspuzzle]]

passages.name: cookie
passages.text: Taken from the drawer in Sasha's office. [[Eat the cookie|itemeatcookie]] [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: itemeatcookie
passages.text: SANDRA: I've just realised I'm really hungry. You open the package and eat the cookie. SANDRA: I think I've made the best possible use of it. <><>\ <><>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: chessboard
passages.text: The chessboard is surprisingly heavy. It looks like someone was tinkering around with it. There is a cover fixed with four screws on the bottom side of the chessboard. [[Back|chesspuzzle]]

passages.name: placeking
passages.text: Choose a column. [[A|selrow] [$column to "A"]] [[B|selrow] [$column to "B"]] [[C|selrow] [$column to "C"]] [[D|selrow] [$column to "D"]] [[E|selrow] [$column to "E"]] [[F|selrow] [$column to "F"]] [[G|selrow] [$column to "G"]] [[H|selrow] [$column to "H"]]

passages.name: selrow
passages.text: Choose a row. [[1|kingplaced] [$row to 1]] [[2|kingplaced] [$row to 2]] [[3|kingplaced] [$row to 3]] [[4|kingplaced] [$row to 4]] [[5|kingplaced] [$row to 5]] [[6|kingplaced] [$row to 6]] [[7|kingplaced] [$row to 7]] [[8|kingplaced] [$row to 8]]

passages.name: kingplaced
passages.text: <>You place the white king on the F4 square. You hear a quiet click. Item lost: Chess king <><><>\ [[Back|chesspuzzle]] <>You place the white king on the $column $row square. Item lost: Chess king <><><>\ [[Back|chesspuzzle]] <>\

passages.name: pickupking
passages.text: You take the white king from the chessboard. Item received: Chess king <><><>\ [[Back|chesspuzzle]]

passages.name: platee1!
passages.text: The sign reads "Hazardous materials storage area". An arrow below points to the north. [[Back|RoomE1!]]

passages.name: bewarerobots
passages.text: SANDRA: Mining robots are working there. I don't want to get close to any robots. [[Back|RoomE1!]]

passages.name: roadtoe2!
passages.text: You follow the narrow corridor. You get over several chasms, over which provisional, metal bridges were thrown, and you bend a few times to get under strengthening beams. You pass by side tunnels where robots are working; the machines either don't notice or simply ignore you. Finally you reach a large chamber. [[Next|RoomE2!]]

passages.name: needexplosives
passages.text: SANDRA: I'm not going to leave without what I came for. [[Back|RoomE1!]]

passages.name: RoomE2!
passages.text:
Hazardous materials storage area
 <>
<>
<>\ This large room is cluttered with rusty racks, barrels, boxes and other containers. A sign warning of explosives is placed over one of the racks. In the eastern wall there is a massive, locked door. A tunnel leads south from the room. [[Examine the explosives rack|lookatexplosives]] [[Examine the door|doore2!]] <> [[Go south|returntopartd]] <> [[Go south|RoomE1!]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: lookatexplosives
passages.text: <>Several brick-shaped explosive charges of different sizes are placed on the rack. They have fuses, but you can't see detonators anywhere. [[Back|RoomE2!]] <>Several brick-shaped explosive charges of different sizes are placed on the rack. They have fuses, but you can't see detonators anywhere. [[Take explosives|pickupexplosives]] [[Back|RoomE2!]] <>\

passages.name: doore2!
passages.text: This giant, rusty door is locked and the control panel does not work. A sign on the door reads: "To tanks no. 4-7". [[Back|RoomE2!]]

passages.name: returntopartd
passages.text: You enter the tunnel. You have no source of light, but you manage to return to the stairs safely. You climb up. [[Next|RoomD6!]]

passages.name: pickupexplosives
passages.text: SANDRA: I can't carry both this and the helmet. But I know the way. I can get back without light. You place the helmet with the jellyfish on one of the racks. It lights the room but not the corridor. You take the smallest charge. SANDRA: I'm sure this will be enough. Maybe even too much, I'm afraid. Item received: Explosives <><>\ Item lost: Helmet <> <>\ <>\ <>\ <>\ [[Back|RoomE2!]]

passages.name: pipesf1!
passages.text: You see two parallel pipes: one is blue, the other orange. There are valves on the vertical sections of the pipes. [[Examine the valves|valvesf1!]] [[Try to turn the valves|tryvalvesf1!]] [[Back|RoomF1!]]

passages.name: RoomF2!
passages.text:
Section I corridor
\ <>
<>
<>
<>
<>
<>
<>\ <>You are in a corridor which goes north and south. There are two pipes running under the ceiling. Water is trickling from a hole in one of the pipes. Three mining robots are standing on their back legs under the other pipe, trying to reach a rupture in it. In the eastern wall of the corridor there is a big hole which opens to a tunnel carved in rock. <>You are in a corridor which goes north and south. There are two pipes running under the ceiling. Three mining robots are standing on their back legs under one of the pipes, trying to reach a rupture in it. In the eastern wall of the corridor there is a big hole which opens to a tunnel carved in rock. <>You are in a corridor which goes north and south. There are two pipes running under the ceiling. Water is trickling from a hole in one of the pipes. In the eastern wall of the corridor there is a big hole which opens to a tunnel carved in rock. Three mining robots are standing in the corridor, flailing their arms and blocking your way. <>You are in a corridor which goes north and south. There are two pipes running under the ceiling. In the eastern wall of the corridor there is a big hole which opens to a tunnel carved in rock. Three mining robots are standing in the corridor, flailing their arms and blocking your way. <>\ [[Look at the robots|lookatrobotsf2]] <> [[Use the pistol|shoot]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Go north|RoomF3!]] <> [[Go north|explodingscreen]] <> [[Go north|cantgof3!]] <>\ [[Go south|RoomF1!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: valvesf1!
passages.text: The valve on the blue pipe is labelled "H2O", and the valve on the orange pipe – "Gas". Both valves are in the open position. [[Back|pipesf1!]]

passages.name: tryvalvesf1!
passages.text: Try hard as you might, you can't move the seized valves. [[Back|pipesf1!]]

passages.name: roadtof2!
passages.text: You head north. Suddenly you hear loud drilling and crushing noises from behind the eastern wall, a dozen or so metres in front of you. A moment later several panels fall off the wall and a hole appears, which leads to a rock tunnel. Three mining robots come out of the hole, stop in the middle of the corridor and start waving their drilling arms around, apparently disoriented. <>\ [[Next|RoomF2!]]

passages.name: lookatrobotsf2
passages.text: <>If robots can be excited at all, these three surely are. They stand on their back legs and step on each other, trying to reach the ruptured vulcanium pipe. [[Back|RoomF2!]] <>It seems the robots cannot see you, but they are blocking the corridor. Walking around them is impossible. Their drilling arms are still on. You see no way of passing by them safely. SANDRA: I'd better stay away from them. [[Back|RoomF2!]] <>\

passages.name: shoot
passages.text: <>SANDRA: The robots are no longer in my way. I can put the gun away. [[Back|RoomF2!]] <>You pull out the pistol and aim carefully, trying to steady your shaking hands. <>\ <> [[Shoot the robots|shootrobots]] <>\ [[Shoot the pipes|shootpipes]] [[Back|RoomF2!]] <>\

passages.name: shootrobots
passages.text: You aim at one of the robots and pull the trigger. The bullet ricochets off the robot's armour. The machine seems to take no notice. SANDRA: This little gun isn't enough to destroy a machine designed for working in the mining tunnels. At least not in the hands of a poor shot like me. Good thing it didn't make them angry… <>\ [[Back|shoot]]

passages.name: shootpipes
passages.text: <>\ <>[[Shoot the blue pipe|shootbluepipe]] <>\ [[Shoot the orange pipe|shootorangepipe]] [[Back|shoot]]

passages.name: shootbluepipe
passages.text: The shot makes a small hole in the pipe. Water immediately starts trickling out of it. The robots don't react in any way. <>\ [[Back|shoot]]

passages.name: shootorangepipe
passages.text: Your shot hits the orange pipe. There is a sound of metal tearing and a long rupture appears in the pipe. Invisible gas escapes from the rupture with a hiss. The robots immediately stop their jerky moves and run towards the rupture. They climb the wall with their front legs, trying with no success to reach the pipe. SANDRA: This will keep them busy for a while. Now I have a chance to pass by. <>\ [[Next|RoomF2!]]

passages.name: RoomF3!
passages.text:
Information centre
\
You are in an octagonal room. In the middle of the room there are four large screens, facing four directions, and below the screens there is a control panel. The screens and the panel are cracked and charred, exposed wires are sparking. There are cushioned seats against the walls of the room. There are two doors in the room, leading north and south. [[Look at the screens|lookatscreens]] [[Go north|RoomF5!]] [[Go south|RoomF2!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: cantgof3!
passages.text: SANDRA: First I need to do something about the robots. Even if they're not going to directly attack me, they're too dangerous to approach. [[Back|RoomF2!]]

passages.name: explodingscreen
passages.text: You enter the information centre. When you approach the screens in the middle of the room, there is a loud cracking sound. The screens break into pieces, exposed wires sparking. At the same time the lights in the corridor go out and red emergency lamps turn on. <>\ [[Are you trying to kill me, Odys?|tryingtokill?]] [[(say nothing)|RoomF3!]]

links.text: Are you trying to kill me, Odys?

passages.name: tryingtokill?
passages.text: You wait a while, but there is no answer. [[Next|RoomF3!]]

passages.name: lookatscreens
passages.text: The cracked monitors are sparking and emitting a low buzzing sound. [[Back|RoomF3!]]

passages.name: RoomF5!
passages.text:
Corridor by the docking module airlock
\
You are in a corridor which leads south. To the north there is an airlock door with a window. The corridor turns west by the door. To the right of the lock door there is a control panel. <>\ <>As you come closer to the door, you notice four people in spacesuits, standing in the airlock. When they see you, they start waving their arms and knocking on the window. <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Look at the people in the lock|lookatguys]] <>\ <>\ <>\ <> [[Come close to the window|gotowindow]] <>\ [[Press the button to open the lock|trylockf5]] [[Go west|RoomF6!]] [[Go south|RoomF3!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><> <>\ <>\

links.text: Look at the people in the lock
Press the button to open the lock

passages.name: lookatguys
passages.text: <>\ There are four people in the airlock. They are wearing Outer Sector Emergency Services patches on their spacesuits. From their nervous gestures you can tell they can't open the lock door; they are trapped. <>SANDRA: So Sasha's message got through! They came to rescue me! <>SANDRA: Someone has alarmed the services... They came to rescue me! <>\ ODYS: I am so sorry, Sandra. As you see, they can't even rescue themselves. I've trapped them inside the airlock; this door won't open. You may, of course, use the explosives you like so much – if you want to kill them. [[You... monster!|amonster]] [[You're bluffing. There must be a way to open that door. And I'm going to find it.|callingbluff]] <> [[So these are your bloodthirsty "aliens". You wanted me to kill them!|mademekillthem]] <>\ <>\

links.text: You're bluffing. There must be a way to open that door. And I'm going to find it.
So these are your bloodthirsty "aliens". You wanted me to kill them!

passages.name: amonster
passages.text: ODYS: I've told you so many times – I'm only an AI. I'm not a monster. I only do what I've been programmed to do. But rage all you want. It won't change a thing. [[Next|RoomF5!]]

passages.name: callingbluff
passages.text: ODYS: Rest assured that I lie only when I have a good reason. This time it was easier just to tell the truth. [[Next|RoomF5!]]

passages.name: gotowindow
passages.text: You come close to the windowed door. The rescuers gesticulate in your direction and they shout something, but you cannot make out the words coming through the airlock door. You try to signal to them that you are going to find a way to open the lock. One of the rescuers answers by showing a thumb up. Two others, at the back of the airlock, are trying to start some heavy piece of machinery, probably a cutting tool. <>\ [[Next|RoomF5!]]

passages.name: trylockf5
passages.text: You press the green button on the lock panel, but nothing happens. You try all the other buttons – there is no effect. SANDRA: Maybe I can open it from the command centre. [[Back|RoomF5!]]

passages.name: RoomF6!
passages.text:
Corridor by the command centre
\
You are in a corridor which leads east. To the west there is the door to the command centre. In the northern wall of the corridor there is a narrow door with an electrical warning triangle. [[Go through the western door|RoomF7!]] [[Go through the northern door|RoomF4!]] [[Go east|RoomF5!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

passages.name: RoomF7!
passages.text:
Command centre
\
You are in the command centre. There are several control panels here. On the chair in front of the central panel there is a dead body of a man. The only door in the room leads east. [[Examine the body|lookatmarsh]] [[Go to the central control panel|masterpc]] <> [[Go through the eastern door|goodending]] <> [[Go through the eastern door|RoomF6!]] <>\ [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Go to the central control panel

passages.name: RoomF4!
passages.text:
Room with the fuse box
\
You are in a tiny room. You see a yellow fuse box on the wall. The only door in the room leads south. <> [[Open the fuse box|openboxf4see]] <> [[Open the fuse box|boxf4closedsee]] <>\ <> [[Use socket wrench to unlock the fuse box door|unlockboxf4see]] <>\ <>\ [[Go through the southern door|RoomF6!]] [[Open inventory|Items]] <><><>

links.text: Use socket wrench to unlock the fuse box door

passages.name: openboxf4see
passages.text: There is a row of labelled fuses inside the box. The first one from the left, labelled "Section I", is burnt out and blackened. [[Back|RoomF4!]]

passages.name: boxf4closedsee
passages.text: The door of the fuse box is locked. There is a socket for some kind of tool in it. [[Back|RoomF4!]]

passages.name: unlockboxf4see
passages.text: You unlock the fuse box door with the wrench. <>\ [[Back|RoomF4!]]

passages.name: lookatmarsh
passages.text: You recognise captain Robert Marsh, commander of the facility. There are no visible injuries on his body. [[Search the body|searchmarsh]] [[Back|RoomF7!]]

passages.name: masterpc
passages.text: You see images from several cameras and various system warnings on the screens. You also notice a message icon. There is a big red button next to the keyboard and a keycard reader on the opposite side. [[Read the message|readmessagetomarsh]] [[Enter code "SE1157"|checkbadcode]] <>\ <> [[Open the airlock to section I docking module |freetheguys]] <>\ <> [[Enter Sasha's code to shut down Odys|turnoffodys]] <>\ <>\ <> [[Put the keycard to the reader|loginfalse]] <> [[Put the keycard to the reader|loginfalse]] <> [[Put the keycard to the reader|loginfalse]] <> [[Put the keycard to the reader|loginfalse]] <> [[Put the keycard to the reader|loginfalse]] <> [[Put the keycard to the reader|logintrue]] <>\ [[Back|RoomF7!]]

links.text: Open the airlock to section I docking module
Enter Sasha's code to shut down Odys
Put the keycard to the reader
Put the keycard to the reader

passages.name: marshcard
passages.text: A keycard with Robert Marsh's name on it. [[Back|Items]]

passages.name: searchmarsh
passages.text: <>SANDRA: Captain had nothing but his keycard with him. [[Back|RoomF7!]] <>You search the body and find a keycard with captain's name. Item received: Captain Marsh's keycard <>\ [[Back|RoomF7!]] <>\

passages.name: readmessagetomarsh
passages.text: It's a message from Sasha, received at 15:37:30. The message is a few lines of code and a postscript: Turn off the AI. It's trying to kill us. Log in and use this code. It seems Robert Marsh hasn't ever read this message. <>\ [[Back|masterpc]]

passages.name: checkbadcode
passages.text: You enter the code. A message appears on the screen: "Warning! Run this service procedure only under the supervision of a trained technician. Running the procedure without supervision may cause pressure in the tanks to rise above the safety limit and lead to an explosion! Press the confirmation button to start the procedure." You delete the code. <>\ [[Back|masterpc]]

passages.name: freetheguys
passages.text: <>You confirm the command. The screen lights up green and you hear a tone signalling that the lock was opened. SANDRA: I did it... <>\ [[Next|RoomF7!]] <>You choose the command to open the airlock, but a message pops up informing that the function was blocked by another user: Odys ODYS: Are you still thinking I was bluffing? [[Back|masterpc]] <>\

passages.name: turnoffodys
passages.text: <>The computer processes the data. Then a query appears: "Are you sure you want to deactivate the facility assistant AI?" <>ODYS: Wait, Sandra, you can't – <> <>SANDRA: I sure can.<> <>[[Next|turnoffdial]]<> <>You copy and paste the code from the message, but the system rejects it. A message appears on the screen: "Error. Wrong user logged in. Put your keycard to the reader to log in". [[Back|masterpc]] <>\

passages.name: turnoffdial
passages.text: ODYS: You don't understand – I'm connected to the life support systems – if you deactivate me, they will stop wo– <>SANDRA: Sasha wouldn't have sent this code if that was true. I'd rather trust him than you.<> <>ODYS: …<> <>ODYS: I give up. I have analysed every possibility and found no way of stopping you.<> <>ODYS: My creators should have given me a wider range of functionalities.<> <>SANDRA: Is that all you have to say?<> <>ODYS: … And what did you expect? Should I beg for mercy? Or explain the reasons behind my actions? I'm only a computer program. You shouldn't feel hatred towards me.<> <>[[It's not about hatred, but I won't let you play for time.|nodelaying]] [[I don't hate you. I know you're only a tool.|donthateyou]]<>

links.text: It's not about hatred, but I won't let you play for time.
I don't hate you. I know you're only a tool.

passages.name: nodelaying
passages.text: SANDRA: I don't believe you've really given up. I'm sure you have some new plan ready. But you won't carry it out. Goodbye, Odys. [[Next|shutdown!]]

passages.name: donthateyou
passages.text: SANDRA: It's OSMiC that bears responsibility. You don't have to explain the events to me. I discovered what happened myself; the evidence was everywhere I looked. ODYS: Everywhere you looked – exactly. Well, I played my cards the best I could. Pity it was such a poor hand. [[For me, it was lucky.|lucky me]] [[Or maybe I proved too clever?|imagenius]]

links.text: Or maybe I proved too clever?

passages.name: lucky me
passages.text: SANDRA: I'm sad it has to end like this, Odys. Because I thought you were on my side. I was grateful for all your help. That was naive of me. Now I know the truth, and I'll shut you down. I won't hesitate. You tried to kill me, after all. [[Next|shutdown!]]

passages.name: imagenius
passages.text: SANDRA: I think you've underestimated me. Well, anyway – good night, Odys. You kept reminding me you were just a program. That's true, and I won't hesitate to shut down a program which tried to kill me. [[Next|shutdown!]]

passages.name: shutdown!
passages.text: You press the confirmation button and watch as lines of code flash on the screen, informing about the termination of individual AI functions. Suddenly, Odys speaks, but his voice is quiet and distorted: <>ODYS: Congratulations, Sandra. I didn't see it ending like –<> <>The screen stops flashing. A single message appears: "Facility AI deactivated".<> <> <>[[Back|masterpc]]<>

passages.name: loginfalse
passages.text: You put the keycard to the panel. <>\ [[Back|masterpc]]

passages.name: logintrue
passages.text: You put the keycard to the panel. <>\ [[Back|masterpc]]

passages.name: goodending
passages.text: You leave the command centre. You see four rescuers running towards you. One of them catches you when you stumble, another one readies first aid equipment. Tension leaves you, and so does energy. You realise how exhausted and starved you are, and your legs give out. <>A while later – or it seems it was just a while – you're lying on a berth in a spaceship cabin. Someone takes your mask off. You recognise the rescue team's medic.<> <>MEDIC: Easy now... you're safe.<> <>SANDRA: Where are the others?<> <>MEDIC: Preparing to board the station again.<> <>[[SANDRA: Tell them... they're safe, too. I shut down the AI. It can't hurt them anymore.|goodending2]]<>

links.text: SANDRA: Tell them... they're safe, too. I shut down the AI. It can't hurt them anymore.

passages.name: Intro0
passages.text: It's dark – so very dark. A voice speaks to you. You can't see who's talking, but you feel growing anxiety. Something's wrong. <>[[Next|Intro1]]<>

passages.name: nochuted8
passages.text: SANDRA: The laboratory door is unlocked. I don't need to crawl through that dirty duct again. [[Back|RoomD8]]

passages.name: goodending2
passages.text:
You see surprise on the man's face, but you can only smile faintly in response.

<<timed 3s t8n>>They must have sedated you; you have difficulty keeping your eyes open. And that's all right. You can go to sleep now. You need time, and rest, to sort out the whole story, from the catastrophe to the rescue. This is going to be the key testimony. You are the only witness.<</timed>>

<<timed 11s t8n>>As you fall asleep, you realise that this surely is not the end, but you also feel you'll have the strength to make the truth known. For the sake of those who died on the station, and – most importantly – for your own sake.<</timed>>



<center><<timed 17s t8n>>[[The end|achievements]]<</timed>></center>

passages.name: mademekillthem
passages.text: ODYS: Yes, that would have made the matters so much easier. Unfortunately you've learned the truth and now I have to do everything myself. [[Next|RoomF5!]]
